msgPlace: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database (Key Numbers)- the First Half of 2022
title: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database (Key Numbers)- the First Half of 2022
txt: By the first half of 2021, a total of 10,312 PPP projects have been registered in the Project Management Database of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform, with a total investment of 16.4 trillion yuan. These projects scatter across the nation and cover 19 sectors, including energy, transportation, water conservancy, ecological and environmental protection, municipal engineering, comprehensive urban development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, tourism, health care, elderly care, education, culture, and sports. PPP contracts of 7,934 projects have been signed, with an investment of 13.1 trillion yuan, 5,280 projects have entered the construction stage, with an investment of 8.7 trillion yuan, and 1,988 projects have entered the operation stage, with an investment of 2.8 trillion yuan.

msgPlace: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database - the First Half of 2020
shortTitle: For the first half of 2020, with the mitigation of the COVID-19 epidemic in China and the intensified efforts to stabilize the investment by the governments at all level, the number of newly-included projects and net investment amount has seen an upward trend.
title: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database - the First Half of 2020
txt:
Executive summary

The following is a summary of China PPP Integrated Information Platform Management Database as of the end of June, 2020:

 

Projects in the Management Database: 482 new projects were included in the database, with an investment of 793.5 billion yuan. Excluding 296 removed projects with 389.6 billion yuan for the period and reduced investment of 22 billion yuan, the net increase of the projects was 186 with an investment of 381.9 billion yuan. For the first half of 2020, with the mitigation of the COVID-19 epidemic in China and the intensified efforts to stabilize the investment by the governments at all level, the number of newly-included projects and net investment amount has seen an upward trend. The investment of newly-included projects for January and February reached 83.5 billion yuan, and the net increase investment was 32.7 billion yuan; the investment of newly-included projects for March and April reached 328 billion yuan, and the net increase investment was 130.7 billion yuan; the investment of newly-included projects for May and June reached 382.1 billion yuan, and the net increase investment was 218.6 billion yuan; among these figures, the investment in newly-included projects in June was the highest at 200.7 billion yuan, and the net increase investment in May was the highest at 124.3 billion yuan, and the net increase investment in June reached 94.3 billion yuan, ranking the third, slightly lower than that in March.

 

In the first half of 2020, the investment of newly-included projects decreased by 220.7 billion yuan or 21.8% on a year-on-year basis, and the net increase investment decreased by 89.5 billion yuan or 19.0% on a year-on-year basis; the number of commercial closing projects was 216, with an investment of 431 billion yuan, representing an decrease of 1.2 trillion yuan or 73.7% on a year-on-year basis; the number of projects entering construction stage was 219, with an investment of 305.9 billion yuan, representing a decrease of 1.7 trillion yuan or 84.4% on a year-on-year

msgPlace: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database 1st Quarter
shortTitle: Since 2014, there have been 9,493 projects with total investment of 14.5 trillion yuan in the Database; there have been total 6,421 commercial closing projects in the Database with total investment of 10.2 trillion yuan, and the commercial closing rate reached 67.6%; there have been 3,771 projects entering into the construction stage, with an investment of 5.7 trillion yuan, and the construction commencement rate was 58.7%.
title: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database 1st Quarter
txt:
March, 2020 

Executive summary

The following is a summary of China PPP Integrated Information Platform Management Database as of the end of March of 2020:

 

Projects in the Management Database: In March, 102 new projects were included in the database, with an investment of 182.2 billion yuan. The investment increased by 136.5 billion yuan or 298.7% on a month on month basis, but decreased by 31.8 billion yuan or 14.9% on a year on year basis. Among them, there was an epidemic prevention and control project with 2.4 billion yuan; removed projects at localities reached 68, with total investment of 84.3 billion yuan, rose by 56.9 billion yuan or 241.3% on a month on month basis, 0.8 billion yuan or 1.0% on a year on year basis; net increase of projects was 34 with an investment of 97.9 billion yuan, increased by 77.0 billion yuan or 369.0% on a month on month basis, but dropped by 6.2 billion yuan or 5.9% on a year on year basis; there was one commercial closing project with an investment of 31.9 billion yuan, decreased by 75.1 billion yuan or 70.2% on a month on month basis, 925.1 billion yuan or 96.7% on a year on year basis; 7 projects entered into construction stage with investment of 16.3 billion yuan, dropped by 11.2 billion yuan or 219.5% on a month on month basis, 1.6324 trillion yuan or 99.0% on a year on year basis.

 

For the first quarter of 2020, 163 new projects were included in the database, with an investment of 265.7 billion yuan, decreased by 225.3 billion yuan or 45.9% on a year-on-year basis; net increase of projects was 53, with an investment of 130.5 billion yuan, decreased by 373.8 billion yuan or 75.5% on a year-on-year basis; the number of commercial closing projects reached 91, with an investment of 296.9 billion yuan, dropped by 942.6 billion yuan or 76.0% on a year-on-year basis; 63 projects entered into construction stage, with an investment of 97.3 billion yuan, decreased by 1.7024 trillion yuan or 94.6% on a year-on-year basis.


Since 2014, there have been 9,493 projects with total investment of 14.5 trillion yuan in the Database; there have been total 6,421 commercial closing projects in the Database with total investment of 10.2 trillion yuan, and the commercial closing rate reached 67.6%; there have been 3,771 projects entering into the construction stage, with an investment of 5.7 trillion yuan, and the construction commencement rate was 58.7%.


Regional distribution. Compared with the data by the end of February, Yunnan with 23.8 billion yuan, Henan with 21.7 billion yuan, Hunan with 19.1 billion yuan, Shaanxi with 11.8 billion yuan, and Guangdong with 11.7 billion yuan ranked the top five as of the end of March in terms of net increase of investment; Yunnan (22.7 billion yuan), Hunan (21.4 billion yuan), Henan (21.3 billion yuan), Tianjin (20.6 billion yuan), and Gansu (20.4 billion yuan) ranked the top five in terms of net increase of investment from the beginning of this year.


Sectoral distribution. Compared with the data by the end of February, transportation (55.3 billion yuan), integrated urban development (24.1 billion yuan), affordable housing (17.5 billion yuan), forestry (8.6 billion yuan), and education (1.9 billion yuan) ranked the top five as of the end of March in terms of net increase of investment; transportation (55.0 billion yuan), integrated urban development (19.0 billion yuan), municipal works (18.0 billion yuan), affordable housing (17.5 billion yuan), and tourism (12.1 billion yuan) ranked the top five in terms of net increase of investment from the beginning of this year.

msgPlace: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database Annual Report 2019
shortTitle: In 2019, there were 1,434 new projects with the total investment of 2.2 trillion yuan in the management database and 648 projects with the total investment of 802.3 billion yuan were removed from the database.
title: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database Annual Report 2019
txt:
Executive summary

The following is a summary of China PPP Integrated Information Platform Management Database as of the end of December of 2019:


Projects in Management Database

In 2019, there were 1,434 new projects with the total investment of 2.2 trillion yuan in the management database and 648 projects with the total investment of 802.3 billion yuan were removed from the database. Compared with the data in the same statistic scope by the end of 2019 (hereinafter referred to on year-on-year basis), net increased number of projects is 786 and net increased investment is 1.2 trillion yuan.


The scale of PPP market increased steadily. As of the end of 2019, there were 9,440 projects in the management database, with a year-on-year increase of 786 and a growth rate of 9.1%; the total investment increased by 1.2 trillion yuan or 9.1% to 14.4 trillion yuan. In 2019, the focus of PPP market shifted from quantity and speed to quality. On year-on-year basis, the number of new projects decreased by 2,640, 64.8% and the investment decreased by 3.6 trillion yuan, 62.1%; net increased number of projects dropped by 731, 48.2% and net increased investment dropped by 1.2 trillion yuan, 50.0%.


Investment of projects entering into construction stage grew substantially year on year. In 2019, there were 1,639 commercial closing projects with total investment of 2.7 trillion yuan, with a year-on-year increase of 58.4 billion yuan and a growth rate of 2.3%; 1,471 projects with investment of 2.4 trillion yuan entered into construction stage, with a year-on-year increase of 876.8 billion yuan and a growth rate of 56.4%. From the beginning of 2014 to the end of 2019, there were total 9,440 projects in the database, with a year-on-year increase of 786 and a growth rate of 9.1%, covering 31 provinces (autonomous regions, municipalities) and Xinjiang Corps and 19 sectors; the total investment was 14.4 trillion yuan, with a year-on-year growth of 1.2 trillion yuan and an increase rate of 9.1%; there were total 6,330 commercial closing projects in the database with total investment of 9.9 trillion yuan, and the commercial closing rate is 67.1%, 12.9 ppts higher than the end of 2018; totally, 3,708 projects have entered into construction stage, with total investment of 5.6 trillion yuan, and the construction commencement rate of projects is 58.6%, 10.9 ppts higher than the end of 2018.

 

There were more projects in the middle and western region. In 2019, Sichuan with 161.5 billion yuan, Chongqing with 151.7 billion yuan, Henan with 150.0 billion yuan, Tianjin with 130.2 billion yuan and Guizhou with 121.4 billion yuan ranked the top five by net investment increase; among them, four are middle and western provinces. Guizhou, Yunnan, Sichuan, Zhejiang and Henan ranked the top five by the total investment of projects in the Database, respectively 1.2 trillion yuan, 1.1 trillion yuan, 1.0 trillion yuan, 976.7 billion yuan and 966.4 billion yuan; four of them are also middle and western provinces.

 

Transportation, municipal works, ecological construction and environmental protection came high on the list. In 2019, transportation, municipal works, integrated urban development, ecological construction and environmental protection, and forestry ranked the top five by net investment increase, respectively 733.2 billion yuan, 192.1 billion yuan, 142.9 billion yuan, 90.8 billion yuan and 71.8 billion yuan. By the total investment in the Database, transportation, municipal works, integrated urban development, ecological construction and environmental protection and tourism ranked the top five, respectively 4.6 trillion yuan, 4.2 trillion yuan, 2.0 trillion yuan, 998.8 billion yuan and 466.6 billion yuan.

 

Viability gap funding projects accounted for a large proportion. In 2019, the net increased investment of user-pay projects reached 314.2 billion yuan, sharing 25.9% of the total net investment increase; the net increased investment of viability gap funding projects was 992.5 billion yuan, accounting for 81.8% of the total net investment increase; and the net increased investment of government-pay projects decreased by 93.2 billion yuan, sharing -7.7% of the total net investment increase. In the Database, there were user-pay projects with investment of 1.4 trillion yuan, viability gap funding projects with investment of 9.7 trillion yuan and government-pay projects with investment of 3.3 trillion yuan.

 

PPP helps to make strides around China’s three priorities (namely controlling major risks, reducing poverty and curbing pollution). The first is fiscal affordability of PPP projects stays in safety intervals. According to the monitoring data by the end of 2019, the fiscal affordability indicator of each of 2,597 local governments nationwide is under 10%, the ratio cap (also called redline) set by the Ministry of Finance of China; and the indicator of 1,873 local governments is below 7%, including 1,406 local governments below 5%. which means their fiscal affordability stays in safety intervals. There were another 19 local governments’ fiscal affordability indicator is higher than 10% in certain future years. According to the data of Transfer-Operate-Transfer (TOT) projects, there were total 259 projects in the Database, with revitalized stock public assets of 269.5 billion yuan; among them, there were 155 commercial closing projects with total investment of 151.6 billion yuan. The second is pollution prevention and green and low-carbon projects accounted for about one third. In 2019, net increased number of projects is 786 and net increased investment is 458.4 billion yuan, sharing 37.8% of the total net investment increase; there were 926 commercial closing projects with total investment of 894.4 billion yuan, accounting for 33.7% of the total investments of commercial closing projects; there were 756 projects entering into construction stage with investment of 680.7 billion yuan, sharing 28.0% of the total investments of projects entering into construction stage. There were total 5,416 projects with 5.2 trillion yuan in the Database, accounting for 35.9%; among them, there were 3,447 commercial closing projects with total investment of 3.4 trillion yuan, accounting for 34.3% and 2,034 projects entering into construction stage with total investment of 2.0 trillion yuan, accounting for 35.7%. The third is about 60% poor counties have been adopting PPP model. 499 of the 832 poor counties in China have been exploring to reduce poverty with PPP model, accounting for 60.0%. There were 1,478 poverty eradication PPP projects in the Management Database with total investment of 1.1 trillion yuan, including 823 commercial closing projects with total investment of 633.9 billion yuan and 453 projects entering in to construction stage with total investment of 302.7 billion yuan. In terms of PPP projects in poor counties, municipal works, transportation, integrated urban development, tourism, ecological construction and environmental protection ranked the top five by investment, respectively 261.9 billion yuan, 193.9 billion yuan, 174.4 billion yuan, 139.2 billion yuan and 115.5 billion yuan. The infrastructure development by PPP model supports poverty alleviation through industry and tourism, and improves the ecological environment in poor counties.

 

Private enterprise participated in stability. There were a total of 6,309 commercial closing projects in the database, including 11,402 commercial partners, and 33.7% of them are private enterprises. It has been basically stable at about 34% since 2018. Private enterprises participated in 2,714 projects with total investment of 3.0 trillion yuan, sharing 43.0% and 30.9% of those of the 6,309 commercial closing projects.

 

Support coordinated and high-quality development among regions. In terms of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Region, net increased number of projects is 76, with net increased investment of 254.8 billion yuan; the total number of projects is 511 with total investment of 1.0682 trillion yuan, sharing 5.4% and 7.0% of those of the Database projects. In terms of 11 provinces of Yangtze River Economic Belt, net increased number of projects is 285, with net increased investment of 489.4 billion yuan; the total number of projects is 4,192 with total investment of 7.4 trillion yuan, sharing 44.4% and 51.6%. In terms of 9 provinces in Yellow River Basin, net increased number of projects is 273, with net increased investment of 494.4 billion yuan; the total number of projects is 3,252 with total investment of 4.3 trillion yuan, sharing 34.4% and 29.6%. In terms of 3 provinces in the Northeast Region, net decrease of projects is 8, but with net increased investment of 7.8 billion yuan; the total number of projects is 465 with total investment of 622.9 billion yuan, sharing 4.9% and 4.3%. In terms of 9 cities in the Pearl River Delta, net increased number of projects is 36, but with net decrease of investment of 21 billion yuan; the total number of projects is 274 with total investment of 346.9 billion yuan, sharing 2.9% and 2.4%.

 

In terms of projects in Pre-pipeline Database, there were 2,922 projects with total investment of 3.2 trillion yuan in the Pre-pipeline Database of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform by the end of 2019.

msgPlace: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database Third Quarter of 2019
shortTitle: For the third quarter of 2019, 412 new projects are included in the database, with an investment of 689.5 billion yuan. Compared with the data of the second quarter, net increase of projects is 213 in the third quarter excluding the removed projects at localities, with an investment of 442 billion yuan.
title: National PPP Integrated Information Platform Project Management Database Third Quarter of 2019
txt:
Executive Summary

    The following is a summary of China PPP Integrated Information Platform Management Database as of the end of third quarter of 2019:

 

Projects in Management Database

       For the third quarter of 2019, 412 new projects are included in the database, with an investment of 689.5 billion yuan. Compared with the data of the second quarter, net increase of projects is 213 in the third quarter excluding the removed projects at localities, with an investment of 442 billion yuan; net increase of commercial closing projects reached 228, with an investment of 33.35 billion yuan; net increase of projects entering into construction stage is 113, with an investment of 204.5 billion yuan.

       In September, 123 new projects were included into the Database, with an investment of 278.4 billion yuan, in which 9 projects are the first ones entering into the Database in their administrative area, involving an investment of 10.6 billion yuan, distributed in 9 provinces. Excluding the removed projects at localities, net increase of new projects is 67 compared with the data of the end of August, involving an investment of 183.9 billion yuan; net increase of commercial closing projects is 79, with an investment of 75.7 billion yuan; the projects entering into construction stage increase by 26, with an investment of 24.3 billion yuan.

       Since the beginning of this year, net increase of new projects included in the Database is 595, with an investment of 913.4 billion yuan; net increase of commercial closing projects is 1348, with an investment of 2 trillion yuan; net increase of projects entering into construction stage is 1322, with an investment of 2.2 trillion yuan.

       Since 2014, there have been 9,249 projects with the total investment of 14.1 trillion yuan in the Database; there have been total 6,039 commercial closing projects in the Database with total investment of 9.2 trillion yuan, and the commercial closing rate reached 65.3%; there have been 3,559 projects entering into the construction stage, with an investment of 5.3 trillion yuan, and the construction commencement rate is 58.9%.

In terms of sector distribution: compared to the data by the end of the last quarter, transportation, municipal project, comprehensive urban development, forestry, and ecological construction and environmental protection with the investment of 225.5 billion yuan, 109.7 billion yuan, 62.2 billion yuan, 35.3 billion yuan, and 19 billion yuan respectively ranked top five by net increase of investment; since 2014, transportation, municipal project, comprehensive urban development, ecological construction and environmental protection and tourism with the investment of 4.4 trillion yuan, 4.1 trillion yuan, 1.9 trillion yuan, 967.9 billion yuan and 449.8 trillion yuan ranked top five by accumulated investment. 

In terms of regional distribution: compared with the data by the end of last quarter, Guizhou with 71.7 billion yuan, Tianjin with 67.1 billion yuan, Henan with 60.2 billion yuan, Hebei with 486 billion yuan and Gansu with 45.3 billion yuan ranked top five provinces in terms of net increase of investment. Since 2014, Guizhou with 1.2 trillion yuan, Yunnan with 1.1 trillion yuan, Sichuan with 1 trillion yuan, Zhejiang with 0.9749 trillion yuan and Henan with 0.9505 trillion yuan ranked top five by accumulated investment.

In terms of return mechanism: by the end of September, the total amount of user-pay projects, viability gap funding projects and government-pay projects accounted for 9.4%, 66.8% and 23.9% of total.

In terms of private enterprise participation: there were a total of 5,990 commercial closing projects having their commercial partners’ ownership information in the database, including 10,713 commercial partners, and 34.6% of them are private enterprises. Private enterprises participated in 2,607 closing projects with total investment of 3.0 trillion yuan, sharing 43.5% and 32.6% of those of the 5,990 commercial closing projects.

In terms of fiscal affordability: there were 2,602 local governments with PPP projects in the Database. Among them, the fiscal affordability indicator of 2,583 local governments is under 10%, the ratio cap (also called redline) set by the Ministry of Finance of China; the indicator of 1,866 local governments is below 7% and the indicator of 1,415 local governments is below 5%. There were another 19 local governments’ fiscal affordability indicator is higher than 10%, which means their new projects are forbidden to entering the Database.

In addition, by the end of September, there were 2,994 projects with RMB 3.3 trillion yuan in the Pre-pipeline Database. Projects in the Pre-pipeline Database haven’t entered the Management Database yet.


Body Text

    In accordance with requirements of the Notice on Standardizing the Operation of PPP Integrated Information Platform (CJ [2015] No. 166), China PPP Integrated Information Platform and Management Database was established. The whole life-cycle of a PPP project contains five phases, respectively identification, preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer. The Management Database includes the PPP projects that are in the preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer phases. As of the end of the third quarter of 2019, the report on Management Database is set out as follows:

 

I. Projects in Management Database

In the third quarter of 2019, there were 412 new projects included in the Management Database with total investment of RMB 689.5 billion. By deducting the number of projects removed from the Database by provincial governments, the net increase of project is 213 with the investment of RMB 442 billion compared with the data by the end of the second quarter of 2019. In September 2019, the Management Database project increased by 67 compared with that of August, with an investment of RMB 183.9 billion. the Management Database project added up to 8,843 with the total investment of RMB 13.4 trillion. As of the end of the third quarter of 2019, there were 9,249 projects in the Management Database, with investment of RMB 14.1 trillion.

The commercial closing rate means the rate of the sum of the projects reaching implementation and transfer stages to the sum of projects in Management Database. Compared with the data by the end of the second quarter of 2019, the net increase of commercial closing project is 228 with an investment of RMB 335.9 billion; compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that by the end of August, the net increase of project is 70 and net increase of investments is RMB 75.7 billion in September. By the end of the third quarter of 2019, there were 6,039 commercial closing projects with an investment of 9.2 trillion with a commercial closing rate of 65.3%. The increase of commercial close rate is 1 ppts compared with that by the end of the previous quarter, and 0.3 ppts higher than last month, and up 16 ppts from the end of the third quarter of last year.

The construction commencement rate refers to the ratio of the number of commercial closing projects that have started construction. In the third quarter, the net increase of projects that have entered into construction stage in the quarter is 113, compared with the previous quarter, and net increase of investment is RMB 204.5 billion. The number of projects started construction in September increased by 26 from August and the investment amount was RMB 24.3 billion. By the end of the third quarter, the number of projects started construction was 3,559, and the investment amount was RMB 5.3 trillion; the construction commencement rate of projects is 58.9%, down 0.4 percentage points from the end of the previous quarter, 0.3 percentage points lower than the previous month, and 13.4 percentage points higher than the end of the third quarter of last year.


(I) The Growth of the Projects in the Management Database Tends to Increase while Maintaining Stable.

    As of the end of the third quarter of 2019, there were 9,249 projects with approved value for money evaluation and fiscal affordability assessment, covering 31 provinces (autonomous regions, municipalities) and Xinjiang Corps as well as 19 sectors. Please see Figure 1-1-1 and Figure 1-1-2 for the number and investment amount from January 2018 to the end of September 2019.

Figure 1-1-1 Monthly net increased number of project in Management Database (Nr.)

Figure 1-1-2 Monthly net increased investment of project in Management Database (in RMB 100 million)


 (II) Local Governments Continue to Regulate the Project Entries

In the third quarter, 412 new projects entered with an investment of RMB 689.5 billion. In September, 123 projects entered with an investment of RMB 278.4 billion; 9 local governments had projects in the Database for the first time, involving 9 projects which were distributed in 9 provinces with an investment of RMB 10.6 billion, which means that the number of regions that actively adopt PPP mode is increasing. Meanwhile, a total of 56 projects had been removed involving an investment of RMB 98.7 billion. The investment amount changes due to the restructuring of the brown projects in the Management Database, therefore, the result of the investment amount of the new entries projects minus the investment of the withdraw projects is not consistent with the investment amount of the net increased/decreased projects.

msgPlace: Quarterly Report on the Project Database of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform 1st Quarter of 2019
shortTitle: As of the end of the first quarter of 2019, compared with the data by the end of the fourth quarter of 2018, net increase of project is 189 with the investment of RMB 225 million (hereinafter referred to as year-over-year basis).
title: Quarterly Report on the Project Database of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform 1st Quarter of 2019
txt:
Executive Summary

The following is a summary of China PPP Integrated Information Platform Management Database as of the end of March of 2019:

 

Projects in Management Database

As of the end of the first quarter of 2019, compared with the data by the end of the fourth quarter of 2018, net increase of project is 189 with the investment of RMB 225 million (hereinafter referred to as year-over-year basis). In March 2019, the Management Database project increased by 63 compared with that of February, with an investment of RMB 104 billion; the Management Database project added up to 8,843 with the total investment of RMB 13.4 trillion. In terms of commercial closing projects, net increase of commercial closing project is 850 with an investment of RMB 1.2 trillion in this quarter; compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that by the end of last quarter, net increase of project is 248 and net increase of investments is 350.2 billion yuan; compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that of the first quarter of last year, net increase of project is 255 and net increase of investments is 335.1 billion yuan. Compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that by the end of February, net increase of project is 621 and net increase of investments is RMB 957 billion in March. By the end of the first quarter, there were 5,541 commercial closing projects with an investment of 8.4 trillion with an commercial closing rate of 62.7%. the increase of commercial close rate is 6.7 ppts compared with that by the end of last month, and 8.5 ppts higher than the end of the previous quarter, and up 17.9 ppts from the end of the first quarter of last year. In terms of projects that have entered into construction stage, the number of projects that have entered into construction stage in the quarter increased by 1,085 and the investment amount was RMB 1.8 trillion; net increase of projects is 708 compared with the previous quarter, and net increase of investment is RMB 1.2 trillion; net increase of projects is 869 compared with the first quarter of last year with an investment of RMB 1.4 trillion. The number of projects started construction in March increased by 949 from February and the investment amount was RMB1.6 trillion. By the end of the first quarter, the number of projects started construction was 3,322, and the investment amount was RMB 5.0 trillion; the construction commencement rate of projects is 60.0%, up 11.8 percentage points from the previous month, 12.3 percentage points higher than the end of the previous quarter, and 18.6 percentage points higher than the end of the first quarter of last year. In terms of regions, compared with the data by the end of last quarter, Guangdong, Sichuan and Henan, with 26 projects, 17 projects and 15 projects respectively ranked top three by net increase of projects; Sichuan, Tianjin and Guizhou respectively with an investment of RMB 88.9 billion, RMB 43.5 billion and RMB 40.2 billion ranked top three by net investment increase. Shandong (including Qingdao), Henan and Sichuan, with 761 projects, 658 projects and 530 projects respectively ranked top three by the total number of projects in the Database; Guizhou, Yunnan and Zhejiang with an investment of RMB 1.1212 trillion, RMB 1.1187 trillion and RMB 944.2 billion respectively ranked top three by the total investment of projects in the Database. In terms of sector distribution, compared with the data by the end of last quarter, municipal works, transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection with the number of projects 93, 33 and 22 respectively ranked top three by net increase of projects; transportation, integrated urban development, municipal works respectively with an investment of RMB 165.8 billion yuan, RMB 43 billion yuan, and RMB 38.7 billion yuan ranked top three by net investment increase. Municipal works, transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection with 3,474 projects, 1,269 projects and 849 projects respectively ranked top three by the total number of projects in the Database; transportation, municipal works and integrated urban development with an investment of RMB 4 trillion yuan, RMB 4 trillion yuan and RMB 1.9 trillion yuan respectively ranked top three by the total investment of projects in the Database. In terms of private enterprise participation, there were 5,452 of 5,541 commercial closing projects having their commercial partners’ ownership information in the database, including 9,565 commercial partners, and 34.9% of them are private enterprises. Private enterprises participated in 2,366 projects with total investment of 2.8 trillion yuan, sharing 43.4% and 33.5%. In terms of return/payment mechanism, compared with the data by the end of last quarter, user-pay project increased by 1 with total investment of RMB 181.8 billion, the viability gap funding project increased by 171 with investment of RMB 53.3 billion, the government-pay project increased by 17 with total investment of RMB 16.9 billion. In the Database, there were total 627 user-pay projects with an investment of RMB 1.3 trillion, 4,892 viability gap funding projects with an investment of RMB 8.7 trillion, and 3,324 government-pay projects with an investment of RMB 3.5 trillion. In terms of consumption sector basic public services (including culture, sports, healthcare, senior care, education and tourism), there were total 1,443 projects with total investment of RMB 1.3 trillion yuan, accounting for 16.3% and 9.7% of the total projects in the Management Database respectively. In terms of pollution prevention and green and low-carbon projects, there were 4,909 projects with investment of RMB 4.4 trillion yuan, accounting for 55.5% and 35.8% of the total projects in the Management Database respectively. In terms of the Yangtze River Economic Zone, the total number of projects is 4,015 with total investment of RMB 7 trillion, sharing 45.4% and 52.4% of those of the Database projects. In terms of the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Region, the total number of projects is 451 with total investment of RMB 883.5 billion, sharing 5.1% and 6.6% of those of the Database projects.

 

National Demonstration Projects 

The 4 batches of National Demonstration Projects totaled 987 with an investment of RMB 2.2 trillion. In terms of commercial closing demonstration projects, compared with the data by the end of last quarter, the net increase of commercial closing demonstration project is 19 with an investment of RMB 33.4 billion, and the commercial closing rate increased 2.1%. Commercial closing projects totaled 914 with an investment of RMB 2 trillion and commercial closing rate of 92.6%, of which 658 commercial closing demonstration projects have entered construction stage, with investment of RMB 1.4 trillion and the construction commencement rate of projects is 72%. In terms of regional distribution, Shandong (including Qingdao), Henan, and Yunnan with 75 projects, 74 projects, and 73 projects respectively ranked top three by  number of commercial closing projects; Yunnan, Hebei, and Beijing with an investment of RMB 281.9 billion, RMB 209.7 billion, and RMB 157.8 billion respectively ranked top three by investment of commercial closing projects. In terms of sector distribution, municipal works, transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection with 402 projects, 95 projects and 87 projects respectively ranked top three by number; municipal works, transportation and integrated urban development with an investment of RMB 733.3 billion, RMB 650.8 billion, and RMB 223.6 billion respectively ranked the top three by investment.

 

Fiscal Affordability

According to the monitoring data by the end of December, the fiscal affordability indicator of each of 2,519 local governments nationwide is under 10%, the ratio cap (also called redline) set by the Ministry of Finance of China; of which, 1,800 local governments is below 7%, 1,378 local governments is below 5%, which means their fiscal affordability stays in safety intervals. There were another 5 local governments’ fiscal affordability indicator is higher than 10% in certain future years. In general, the potential financial risks of PPP projects are effectively monitored and controlled.

 

Pre-Pipeline Database

The first quarter in 2019 witnessed a net decrease of 237 projects with an investment of RMB 266.1 billion in the Pre-pipeline Database; 46 net decrease projects in March compared to February with an investment of RMB 21 billion; there were 3,734 projects in the Pre-pipeline Database with an investment of RMB 4.3 trillion.

 

Body Text 

In accordance with requirements of the Notice on Standardizing the Operation of PPP Integrated Information Platform (CJ [2015] No. 166), China PPP Integrated Information Platform and Management Database was established. The whole life-cycle of a PPP project contains five phases, respectively identification, preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer. The Management Database includes the PPP projects that are in the preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer phases. As of the end of 2018, the report on Management Database is set out as follows：


I. Projects in Management Database

As of the end of the first quarter of 2019, compared with the data by the end of the fourth quarter of 2018, net increase of project is 189 with the investment of RMB 252 million (hereinafter referred to as year-over-year basis). In March 2019, the Management Database project increased by 63 compared with that of February, with an investment of RMB 104 billion; the Management Database project added up to 8,843 with the total investment of RMB 13.4 trillion.

 

The commercial closing rate means the rate of the sum of the projects reaching implementation and transfer stages to the sum of projects in Management Database.  In the first quarter, the net increase of commercial closing project is 850 with an investment of RMB 1.2 trillion in this quarter; compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that by the end of last quarter, net increase of project is 248 and net increase of investments is 350.2 billion yuan; compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that of the first quarter of last year, net increase of project is 255 and net increase of investments is 335.1 billion yuan. Compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that by the end of February, net increase of project is 621 and net increase of investments is RMB 957 billion in March. By the end of the first quarter, there were 5,541 commercial closing projects with an investment of 8.4 trillion with an commercial closing rate of 62.7%. the increase of commercial close rate is 6.7 ppts compared with that by the end of last month, and 8.5 ppts higher than the end of the previous quarter, and up 17.9 ppts from the end of the first quarter of last year.

 

The construction commencement rate refers to the ratio of the number of commercial closing projects that have started construction. In the first quarter, the number of projects that have entered into construction stage in the quarter increased by 1,085 and the investment amount was RMB 1.8 trillion; net increase of projects is 708 compared with the previous quarter, and net increase of investment is RMB 1.2 trillion; net increase of projects is 869 compared with the first quarter of last year with an investment of RMB 1.4 trillion. The number of projects started construction in March increased by 949 from February and the investment amount was RMB1.6 trillion. By the end of the first quarter, the number of projects started construction was 3,322, and the investment amount was RMB 5.0 trillion; the construction commencement rate of projects is 60.0%, up 11.8 percentage points from the previous month, 12.3 percentage points higher than the end of the previous quarter, and 18.6 percentage points higher than the end of the first quarter of last year.

 


(I) The Growth of the Projects in the Management Database Tends to Be increasing stably

As of the end of the first quarter of 2019, there were 8,843 projects with approved Value for Money evaluation and fiscal affordability assessment, covering 31 provinces (autonomous regions, municipalities) and Xinjiang Corps and 19 sectors. Please see Figure 1-1-1 and Figure 1-1-2 for the number and investment amount from January 2018 to the end of March 2019.

 

(II) Local Governments Continue to Regulate the Project Entries

In the first quarter, the local governments further regulated the examination of the new projects and contentiously remove the irregular projects. A total of 93 projects had been removed involving an investment of RMB 134.4 billion; 282 new projects entered with an investment of RMB 491 billion. In March, a total of 49 projects had been removed involving an investment of RMB 83.5 billion; 112 new projects entered with an investment of RMB 214 billion. The investment amount changes due to the restructuring of the brown projects in the Management Database, therefore, the result of the investment amount of the new entries projects minus the investment of the withdraw projects is not consistent with the investment amount of the net increased/decreased projects.

 

(III) Regional Distribution of Projects in the Management Database

By net increase of projects in the first quarter, Guangdong, Sichuan, and Henan with 26 projects, 17 projects, and 15 projects respectively ranked the top three, as shown in Figure 1-3-1. By investment amount of project entries, Sichuan and Tianjin. Guizhou, respectively with an investment of RMB 88.9 billion, RMB 43.5 billion and RMB 40.2 billion ranked the top three, as shown in Figure 1-3-2. 

 

By total number of projects, Shandong (including Qingdao), Henan, and Sichuan with 761 projects, 658 projects, and 530 projects respectively ranked the top three, accounting for 22.0% of the total number in the Management Database; by total investment amount, Guizhou, Yunnan, and Zhejiang with a total investment of 1,121.2 RMB billion, RMB 1,118.7 billion, and RMB 944.2 billion ranked the top three, accounting for 23.7% of the total investment in the Management Database. The comparison of the number of Management Database projects and investment amount by the end of the fourth quarter of 2018 and the end of the first quarter of 2019 in each place are shown in Figure 1-3-3 and Figure 1-3-4.


(IV) Sectorial Distribution of Projects in the Management Database 

The Project Database includes a total of 19 primary industries such as energy, transportation, water conservancy, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal works, integrated urban development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, affordable housing, tourism, healthcare, senior care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructure and others.

 

In the first quarter, municipal works, transportation, and ecological construction and environmental protection with 93 projects, 33 projects and 22 projects respectively ranked the top three by number of projects increased, as shown in Figure 1-4-1.


Transportation, integrated urban development, and municipal works with an investment of RMB 165.8 billion , RMB 43 billion, RMB 38.7 billion respectively ranked top three by increase in investment amount of project entries, as shown in Figure 1-4-2.


The total number of PPP projects and investment by sector in the Management Database are shown in Figure 1-4-3 and figure 1-4-4. Municipal works, transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection ranked top three by number of projects, accounting for 63.3% of the total number of projects in the  Management Database; transportation, municipal works, and integrated urban development ranked top three by investment of projects, accounting for 73.5% of the total investment of the Management Database.


(V) The Commercial Closing Projects

In the first quarter, compared with the data in the same statistic scope as that by the end of last quarter, net increase of commercial closing project is 850 with an investment of RMB 1.2 trillion in this quarter, and the commercial close rate is 8.5 ppts higher than the end of the previous quarter. By the end of the first quarter, there were 5,541 commercial closing projects with an investment of 8.4 trillion with an commercial closing rate of 62.7%, covering 30 provinces (autonomous regions, municipalities) and Xinjiang Corps except Tibet and 19 sectors. There were currently no projects in transfer stage. The number of projects at the end of the fourth quarter of 2018 and the end of the first quarter of 2019 are shown in Figure 1-5-1.


Regional Distribution. By net increase of projects in the first quarter, Henan (125), Zhejiang (83), Guizhou (56) and Guangdong (56) ranked the top three in the list; by investment amount of project entries, Zhejiang, Henan and Guizhou, respectively with RMB 197.3 billion, RMB 169.4 billion, and RMB 199.2 billion ranked the top three, as shown in Figures 1-5-2 and 1-5-3.


By cumulative number of projects, Shandong (including Qingdao) with 491 projects, ranking first among the provinces; Henan with 397 projects and Zhejiang with 359 projects, ranking second and third respectively; Zhejiang, Yunnan, Guizhou ranked the top three with the total investment amount of the project RMB 709.7 billion, RMB 667 billion, and RMB 651.6 billion. The number of projects and investment in different places are shown in Figure 1-5-4 and 1-5.5. 

Commercial closed rate. There are 3 PPP projects in Shanghai and all of them reached commercial close. Shanghai ranked the first place with 100% commercial close rate; Hainan (82/94) ranked the second place with 87.2% commercial close rate, ranking second; and Beijing (53/64) ranked the third place with 82.8 % commercial close rate.


Industrial Distribution. In the first quarter, municipal works, transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection with the number of projects of 378, 136, 65 ranked the top three by number of projects increased. By increase in investment amount of project entries, transportation, municipal works and integrated urban development with the investment of RMB 377.4 billion, RMB 357.4 billion and RMB 308.6 billion respectively, as shown in Figure 1-5-6 and 1-5-7.

By cumulative number of projects, municipal works, transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection with the number of 2,280, 785 and 525, respectively ranked the top three by number of projects and accounted for 64.8% of the total number of the commercial closing projects; municipal works, transportation, integrated urban development with the investment of RMB 2.8 trillion, RMB 2.2 trillion and RMB 1.3 trillion respectively ranked top three and accounted for 74.9% of the total investment of the commercial closing projects, as shown in Figure 1-5-8 and 1-5-9.

(VI) Private Enterprises Participating 

The type of private sector. There were 5,452 projects out of 5,541 commercial closed projects having their commercial partners’ ownership information in the database, involving 9,565 commercial partners which include 3,341 private enterprises, 136 from Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan, China, 69 from foreign countries, 4,916 were state-owned enterprises, and other 1,103 enterprises with undefined category. The private enterprises takes 34.9% of all the private partners signing PPP contracts, as shown in Figure 1-6-1.


Breakdown of sectors with private enterprises’ participation. 2,366 commercial closed projects with total investment of 2.8 trillion yuan having their commercial partners’ ownership information in the database, sharing 43.4% and 33.5%.

 

Private-owned and private holding partners were involved in 19 industrial sectors, as described in Figure 1-6-2 and 1-6-3. Municipal works projects (1,009), ecological construction and environmental protection projects (234) and transportation (185) ranked top three by number of projects involved with exclusive private capital. Integrated urban development (RMB 755.4 billion), municipal works (RMB 675.52 billion), and transportation (RMB 517.4 billion) ranked top three by investment amount of projects involved with exclusive private capital.

(VII) Basic public service projects in the field of consumption

The main scope of the basic public services covers culture, sports, healthcare, senior care, education, and tourism. There are 13 projects, with an investment of RMB 3 billion, increased in the first quarter compared with that of the last quarter. There are total 1,443 basic public services projects with investment of RMB 1.3 trillion yuan, representing 16.3% and 9.7% of total projects and investments in Management Database. By the number of projects, education (425), tourism (334), and healthcare (247.1) ranked the top three; by investment amount, tourism (RMB 476.3 billion yuan), education (RMB 240.7 billion yuan), and healthcare (RMB 202.7 billion yuan) ranked the top three. See figure 1-7-1.

 

There are 821 basic public services projects reaching commercial close in the Management Database with investment of RMB 662.4 billion yuan, respectively sharing 14.8% and 7.8% of that in the Management Database. Education projects (250), healthcare projects (171) and tourism projects (170) ranked the top three by the number of projects; by investment amount, tourism (RMB 216.3 billion yuan), education (RMB 143 billion yuan), and healthcare (RMB 107 billion yuan) ranked the top three. See Figure 1-7-2 for details.

(VIII) Pollution Prevention, Green and Low-carbon Projects

PPP projects in a number of fields, including public transportation, water supply and drainage, ecological construction and environmental protection, water conservancy, renewable energy, education, science and technology, culture, senior care, healthcare, forestry and tourism, play a role in promoting a pollution prevention, green and low-carbon economic structure. There are 143 projects, with an investment of RMB 96.4 billion, increased in the first quarter compared with that of the last quarter. There were 4,909 pollution prevention, green and low-carbon projects enter the Management Database with investment of RMB 4.8 trillion yuan, accounting for 55.5% and 35.8% of national totals respectively. The commercial closed projects are 2,993 with total investment of RMB 2.9 trillion yuan, accounting for 54.0% and 33.8% of national totals respectively. The comparison between the end of the fourth quarter of 2018 and the end of the first quarter of 2019 is shown in Figure 1-8-1 and Figure 1-8-2.

(Ⅸ) PPP in Yangtze River Economic Zone

The Yangtze River Economic Zone covers 11 provinces/cities, i.e. Shanghai, Jiangsu, Zhejiang, Anhui, Jiangxi, Hubei, Hunan, Chongqing, Sichuan, Yunnan and Guizhou. There are 82 projects, with an investment of RMB 143.9 billion, increased in the first quarter compared with that of the last quarter. The accelerated number of project in this region is 4,015 with total investment of RMB 7.0 trillion, sharing 45.4% and 52.4% of the Management Database projects. By the number of projects in the Management Database, Sichuan (530), Guizhou (527) and Zhejiang (497) ranked the top three; by investment amount of the projects, Guizhou (RMB 1.1 trillion yuan), Yunnan (RMB 1.1 trillion yuan), and Zhejiang (RMB 944.2 billion yuan) ranked top three, as shown in Figure 1-9-1.


The commercial closed projects are 2,433 with total investment of RMB 4.3 trillion yuan, accounting for 43.9% and 51.3% of national totals respectively. Zhejiang (359) ranked the first place by the number of commercial closed projects, followed by Anhui (331) and Sichuan (302); by investment amount of commercial closed projects, Zhejiang (RMB 709.7 billion yuan), Yunnan (RMB 667 billion yuan), and Guizhou (RMB 615 billion yuan) ranked the top three. See Figure 1-9-2.

(Ⅹ) PPP in Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Region

The Management Database had 16 net increase projects in the first quarter, with an investment of RMB 70.1 billion. The total number of projects in the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei region was 451, with an investment of RMB 883.5 billion, accounting for 5.1% and 6.6% of the Management Database respectively. The investment amounted to RMB 644.9 billion, accounting for 5.5% and 7.7% of the Management Database commercial projects respectively. Figure 1-1-10 and Figure 1-10-2 are shown in details.


 

(Ⅺ) Analysis of the return mechanism

According to the statistics of three kinds of return mechanisms, the Management Database has one net increase project for the user-pay projects in the first quarter, with an investment amount of RMB 181.8 billion; the feasibility gap subsidy (that is, the government market mixed payment) projects increased by 171 projects with an investment of RMB 53.3 billion ; the government's pay projects have 17 net increase projects with an investment of RMB 16.9 billion , as shown in Figures 1-11-1 and 1-11-2.

There are 627 user-pay projects with an investment of RMB 1.3 trillion in the Management Database, accounting for 7.1% and 9.4% of the Management Database respectively; 4,892 totaled feasibility gap subsidy projects with an investment of RMB 8.7 trillion, accounting for projects in the Management Database 55.3% and 64.9% respectively; 3,324 totaled government-pay projects with an investment of RMB 3.5 trillion, accounting for 37.6% and 25.7% of projects in the Management Database respectively, as shown in Figures 1-11-3 and 1-11-4.

 

Statistics from the commercial closing projects show that the number of net increase commercial closing projects for user-pay, feasibility gap subsidies, and government-pay in the first quarter is 25, 487 and 338 respectively with an investment of RMB 24.3 billion, RMB 932.4 billion, RMB 2,82.8 billion.

The Management Database has totaled 377 user-pay projects with an investment of RMB 507.6 billion; 2,666 totaled feasibility gap subsidies with an investment of RMB 5.2 trillion; 2,498 totaled government-pay projects with an investment of RMB 2.7 trillion as shown in Figure 1-11-5, Figure 1-11-6.

(Ⅻ) Over half of the commercial closing projects have started construction

In the first quarter, the number of projects started construction has increased by 1,085 with an investment of RMB 1.8 trillion; there were totaled 3,322 projects in the Management Database with investment of RMB 5.0 trillion, accounting for 60.0% and 58.7% of all the projects respectively. The proportion of projects starting construction increased by 12.3 percentage points from the previous month.

By the number of projects that have started construction, Shandong (including Qingdao), Anhui, and Guangdong ranked in the top three, respectively, 356, 269, and 253, with a construction commencement rate of 72.5%, 81.3%, and 71.7% respectively; Yunnan, Shandong (including Qingdao) and Zhejiang ranked top three by the investment amount of projects that entering into construction phrase, with an investment of RMB 421.8 billion, RMB 388.1 billion, and RMB 359 billion respectively. See Figure 1-12-1 and Figure 1-12-2.

II. Implementation of national demonstration projects

By the end of the first quarter of 2019, there were 987 demonstration projects in four batches with an investment of RMB 2.2 trillion, covering 31 provinces (autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the Central Government), Xinjiang Corps and 19 industries. Among them, there were 20 first demonstration projects in 2014 (10 were excluded from the original 30) with an investment of RMB 56.6 billion ; the second batch of demonstration projects was 158 (48 were successively excluded from the original 206) with an investment of RMB 460.2 billion in 2015; the third batch of demonstration projects in 2016 was 425 (91 were successively excluded from the original 516,) with an investment of RMB 923.6 billion; the fourth batch of demonstration projects 384 (12 were successively excluded from the original 396) with an investment of  RMB 717.2 billion. There were 914 demonstration projects reached commercial close with an investment of RMB 2.0 trillion, covering 19 industries.

 

(I) National Demonstration Projects in Different Phases

Demonstration projects have been in the procurement or implementation phase since June 2018. By the end of the first quarter, the number of demonstration projects in the procurement and implementation phases was 73 and 914 with an investment of RMB 116.1 billion and RMB 2,041 billion respectively. The number of demonstration projects and the amount of investment in each stage of the management database at the end of the fourth quarter and the end of the first quarter are shown in Figure 2-1-1 and Figure 2-1-2.


(II) More than 90% of the National Demonstration Projects Reached Commercial Close

In the first quarter, the number of national demonstration projects increased by 19 with an investment of RMB 33.4 billion, and the commercial closing rate increased by 2.1 percentage points. In March, the number of demonstration projects increased by 9 from the previous month, with the investment amount was RMB 24 billion. The commercial closing rate increased by 0.9 percentage points. By the end of the first quarter of 2019, there were 914 national demonstration projects with an investment of RMB 2.0 trillion and the commercial closing rate of 92.6%. There were currently no projects in transfer stage. Change of commercial closing rate of the national demonstration project is shown in Figure 2-2-1.

 

The first batch of the 20 demonstration projects have all reached commercial close since the end of 2016, and the second batch of 158 demonstration projects have all reached commercial close since the end of March 2017; the third batch of 425 demonstration projects have all reached commercial close since March of 2018. 311 of the fourth batch demonstration projects have reached commercial close, and the commercial closing rate is 81.0 %. See Figure 2-2-2 for the commercial closing rate of each batch of the National Demonstration Projects.

（III）Municipal works continued to take the lead

The commercial closing demonstration project has covered all 19 primary industries. Among the 914 the commercial closing demonstration projects, 402 were municipal works projects, accounting for 44.0%; 95 were transportation, accounting for 10.4%; 87 were ecological construction and environmental protection, accounting for 9.5%; and 330 were other categories, accounting for 36.1%. The distribution of the demonstration project industry at the end of the first quarter is shown in Figure 2-3-1. The comparison between the number of demonstration projects in various industries and the number of commercial closing projects is shown in Figure 2-3-2.

(IV) Shandong, Henan and Yunnan Ranked Top Three by the Number of Commercial Closing Demonstration Projects

According to regional statistics on commercial closing projects, Shandong (including Qingdao City) ranked the first across China with 75 National Demonstration Projects entered the implementation stage, followed by Henan with 74, Yunnan with 73, Hebei with 58, Anhui with 55, Hubei with 51 and the remaining provinces are less than 50. Yunnan. The comparison between the number of demonstrative projects and the number of commercial closing projects are seen in Figure 2-4.


(V) Private Enterprises Participating in the Demonstration Projects Reached 40%

The type of commercial partners. 914 commercial closing projects are composed of 461 exclusive private capital projects and 453 with a consortium led by private capital. There were 1,589 private partners signing PPP contracts, in which 648 partners were private enterprises, 42 from Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan, China, 18 from foreign countries, 880 were state-owned, and another 42 enterprises with undefined category. The private enterprises takes 39.7% of all the private partners signing PPP contracts with a growth of 0.1 ppts on year-on-year basis (see Figure 2-5-1).


Private enterprises’ participation. Private enterprises participated in 474 projects with total investment of RMB 793.8 billion , sharing 51.9 % and 38.9 % of those of the commercial closing projects. Private-owned and private holding partners were involved in 19 sectoral sectors, as described in Figure 2-5-2 and 2-5-3. Municipal works projects (188), ecological construction and environmental protection projects (54) and senior care projects (28) ranked top three by number of projects involved with exclusive private capital. Transportation (RMB 215.5 billion), integrated urban development (RMB 174.3 billion) and municipal works (RMB 150.9 billion) ranked top three by investment amount of projects involved with exclusive private capital.

 

(VI) Shandong takes the lead by number of commercial closing demonstration projects

At the end of the first quarter, 658 commercial closing demonstration projects with total investment of RMB 1.4 trillion have been started, accounting for 72.0% of starting construction rate, increasing 13.0 percentage. Among them, Shandong (including Qingdao), Yunnan, and Anhui ranked the top three by number of projects that started construction, respectively 65, 54 and 52, accounting for 78.7%, 96.4% and 72.6% of their commercial closing demonstration projects, respectively. Yunnan, Beijing and Shandong (including Qingdao) ranked the top three by investment amount of demonstration projects that started construction with investment of RMB 193.5 billion, RMB 128.6 billion and RMB 102.6 billion respectively, as shown in Figure 2-6-1 and Figure 2-6-2.


Ⅲ Fiscal Affordability

To facilitate financial risks management, the National PPP Integrated Information Platform has developed functions of dynamically monitoring local governments’ fiscal expenditure responsibility of PPP projects and consequently fiscal affordability.

 

According to the monitoring data by the end of March 2019, there were 2,524 local governments (including provincial level, municipal level, district and county level) have developed PPP projects. Among them, 2,519 local governments’ fiscal affordability indicator are under 10%, the ratio cap (also called redline); 1800 local governments’ fiscal affordability is below 7% warning line, which means their fiscal affordability indicator stays in safety intervals including 1378 local governments’ fiscal affordability below 5%. There were another 5 local governments’ fiscal affordability indicator is higher than 10% in certain future years. As a result, their new projects are forbidden to entering the Management Database. In general, the potential financial risks of PPP projects are effectively monitored and controlled. In addition, there were 1160 local governments which do not have projects in the Management Database.


The financial expenditure responsibility of all PPP management projects in the next 30 years (2019-2048) totaled RMB 16.5 trillion, including general public budget expenditure responsibility of RMB 13 trillion and government fund expenditure responsibility of RMB 3.5 trillion. Among them, the financial expenditure responsibility of the project has reached RMB 10.7 trillion, including RMB 8.1 trillion for general public budget expenditure and RMB 2.6 trillion for government fund expenditure. From the perspective of time distribution, as shown in Figure 3-1, the peak responsibility of all project expenditures was RMB 1001.8 billion in 2025, including general public budget expenditure responsibility of RMB 771.5 billion and government fund expenditure responsibility of 230.3 billion.


IV. Others

The first quarter in 2019 witnessed a net decrease of 237 projects with an investment of RMB 266.1 billion in the Pre-pipeline Database; 46 net decrease projects in March compared to February with an investment of RMB 21 billion; there were 3,734 projects in the Pre-pipeline Database with an investment of RMB 4.3 trillion.
