Out of the third batch of demonstration projects, 280 were in implementation stage with implementation rate of 54.6%, an increase of 26 implemented projects and 5.1 percentage points of implementation rate over the previous month, and an increase of 60 implemented projects and 11.7 percentage points of implementation rate over the previous year. See Figure 1-1-4 for implementation rates of the three batches of demonstration projects. 

   

Figure 1-1-4: Implementation rates of the first, second and third batches of demonstration projects at the end of March

(II) Implemented municipal works continued to take the lead

The Project Database includes a total of 19 primary industries such as energy, transportation, water conservancy, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal works, integrated urban development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, affordable housing, tourism, healthcare, senior care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructure and others. 

Among 464 implemented demonstration projects, the top 3 are related to municipal works, transportation and ecological construction and environmental protection. There were 216 municipal works projects, accounting for 46.6% and implying an increase of 18 over the previous month, 36 over the previous year and 192 over the same period last year; there were 45 transportation projects, accounting for 9.7% and implying an increase of 5 over the previous month, 8 over the previous year and 40 over the same period last year; there were 39 ecological construction and environmental protection projects, accounting for 8.4% and implying an increase of 5 over the previous month, 9 over the previous year and 15 over the same period last year; there were 164 remaining projects, accounting for 35.3%. For details, see Figure 1-2-1. Comparison between demonstration projects and implemented demonstration projects of each sector at the end of March is illustrated in Figure 1-2-2. 

Among 56 new implemented demonstration projects in the current month, new implemented municipal works demonstration projects (18) top the list, followed by new implemented cultural demonstration projects (7), with transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection and healthcare accounting for 5 new implemented demonstration projects, respectively. Such five categories combined took up 71.4% of new implemented demonstration projects in the current month.

 

Figure 1-2-1 Breakdown of implemented demonstration projects at the end of March by industries (Nr.)

 

Figure 1-2-2 Comparison between demonstration projects and implemented demonstration projects of each sector as of the end of March

(III) Henan, Shandong and Yunnan made the top 3 in the list by number of implemented demonstration projects

According to the numbers of implemented demonstration projects of each province, Henan ranked first in China with 52 national demonstration projects which have entered the stage of implementation upon contract signing, followed by Shandong (40), Yunnan (29), Hebei (28), Anhui (28), Fujian (23), Zhejiang (21), Inner Mongolia (21) and other regions (less than 20). The above 8 provinces combined accounted for 52.2% of total implemented demonstration projects.

Figure 1-3 Comparison between demonstration projects and implemented demonstration projects of each province as of the end of March

Over the previous month, top 3 provinces by increase, i.e., Henan, Yunnan, Fujian and Hubei, took up 19, 8, 4 and 4 of 56 new implemented demonstration projects in the current month, respectively; over the previous year, top 3 provinces by increase, i.e., Henan, Fujian and Yunnan, accounted for 21, 10 and 9 of 101 new implemented demonstration projects this quarter, respectively; compared with the same period last year, top 3 provinces by increase, i.e., Henan, Shandong and Yunnan, took up 40, 36 and 25 of 391 new implemented demonstration projects.

(IV) Share of private enterprises showed slight fluctuation butmore sectors were involved

Analysis from the perspective of type of social capital partners.As of the end of March, information about signed social capital partners of 455 implemented demonstration projects including 261 individual social capital projects and 194 joint projects have been entered. There were a total of 716 signed social capital partners including 144 private solely-invested enterprises, 118 privately controlled enterprises, 20 Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan enterprises, 15 foreign-invested enterprises, 221 wholly state-owned enterprises, 174 state-controlled enterprises and 24 other enterprises with categories difficult to identify. There were 262 private enterprises (including private solely-invested enterprises and privately controlled enterprises), accounting for 36.6% (see Figure 1-4-1), 1.3 percentage points lower than statistical results as of the end of the previous month and 2.3 percentage points lower than statistical results as of the end of the previous year.

 

Figure 1-4-1 Classification and proportion of 716 social capital partners

Analysis from the perspective of fields with the presence of private enterprises.There were a total of 215 private projects and joint projects including private joint projects and foreign funded projects, accounting for 47.3% of implemented projects. Private enterprises were involved in 15 industrial sectors and sports sector was a newcomer in the current month as described in Figure 1-4-2. There were 86 municipal works projects, 23 ecological construction and environmental protection projects, 15 water conservancy projects, 14 senior care projects, 13 transportation projects, 11 healthcare projects, and 10 integrated urban development projects. Each of the remaining sectors had less than 10 projects.

Figure 1-4-2 Breakdown of implemented demonstration projects including private projects and foreign-funded projects by sector

II. National total project entries

As of the end of March 2017, national total reached 12,287, with investments of RMB 14.6 trillion, implying net increases of 503 projects and RMB 611.4 billion of investment over the previous month, 1,027 projects and RMB 1,068.6 billion of investment over the previous year, and 4,566 projects and RMB 5,788 billion of investment over the same period last year. Investments of 1,729 signed implemented projects totaled RMB 2.9 trillion, indicating net increase of 207 implemented projects and RMB 436.7 billion over the previous month, 378 implemented projects and RMB 636.9 billion of investment over the previous year, and 1,360 projects and RMB 2,356.7 billion of investment over the same period last year.

There were 543 new project entries in March after review. Meanwhile, upon applications of provincial finance departments, 40 projects entries made as of the end of February have been cancelled (with investments of RMB 48.8 billion), a net increase of 503 projects over the previous month. Compared with last year, new project entries in the current quarter after review totaled 1,161 while 134 project entries have been cancelled, hence implying a net increase of 1,027 project entries this quarter. It is learnt from provincial finance departments that, there were three major reasons for that. Firstly, PPP mode was no longer used for projects. Some projects were less attractive for social capital and some projects have finalized financing through other modes. Secondly, project entries were repeated. Fields of implementation subjects of some projects have been changed and project information both in the previous field and the current field has been input in the project database; some projects have been included in other project entries and were no longer deemed as individual projects. Thirdly, projects were halted. Due to property right dispute, environmental impact and immature planning, projects cannot move forward and have been halted by governments. 

(I) Growing demand for PPP projects

Overall project entries and project entries at each stage are described in Figure 2-1-1 and investments are shown in Figure 2-1-2. Showing a growth trend, average new project entries from the end of January 2016 to the end of March 2017 reached 378 with investments of RMB459.7 billion, indicating growing demand for PPP projects. It is important to note that, as of the end of March, 59.2% projects in the database remained at the identification stage and they are deemed as alternative PPP projects. Firstly, implementation will be carried out in next several years as planned; secondly, value-for-money evaluation and financial affordability assessment have not been completed and local government merely expressed their intentions of adoption of PPP mode. For projects to become real PPP projects, it is imperative to conduct strict assessment. However, 1,729 projects have been signed and entered into the implementation stage as of the end of March, with investments of RMB 2.9 trillion, indicating considerable investments of implemented projects. 

 

Figure 2-1-1 Quarterly changes in project entries by stage (Nr.)

 

Figure 2-1-2 Quarterly changes in investment amounts of project entries by stage (in RMB 1 trillion)

(II) High regional concentration 

By number of project entries, Guizhou (1,805), Shandong (including Qingdao) (1,132) and Xinjiang (1,050) made the top three in the list and combined accounted for 32.4% of total project entries. By investment amounts of project entries, Guizhou (RMB 1,619.5 billion), Shandong (including Qingdao) (RMB 1,246.8 billion) and Yunnan (RMB 1,103.7 billion) were top three provinces and combined accounted for 27.3% of total investments of project entries. Comparisons of project entries and investment amounts of various regions at the end of February and March are shown in Figure 2-2-1 and Figure 2-2-2, respectively.

Figure 2-2-1 Comparison of geographic distribution of project entries as of the end of February and March (Nr.)

 

Figure 2-2-2 Comparison of geographic distribution of project investments as of the end of February and March (in RMB 100 million)


 

By net increase in project entries in the current month, Xinjiang (108), Inner Mongolia (107) and Jiangsu (35) stayed in the top three places and combined accounted for 49.7% of total net increase in project entries in the current month; by net increase in investment, top three provinces were Xinjiang (RMB 160.1 billion), Inner Mongolia (RMB 101.5 billion) and Yunnan (RMB 62.4 billion) and combined took up 53.0% of total net increase in investments in the current month. Compared with the previous year, net increase in project projects this quarter reached 1,027. By net increase, Xinjiang (198), Inner Mongolia (177) and Hunan (150) made top three in the list and combined accounted for 51.1% of total net increase in project entries this quarter; by net increase in investments of project entries, Xinjiang (RMB 214.3 billion), Hunan (RMB 207.9 billion) and Inner Mongolia (RMB 135.4 billion) were top three provinces and combined accounted for 52.2% of total net increase in investment amount this quarter. Compared with the same period last year, all regions contributed to 4,566 new project entries. By net increase in project entries, Inner Mongolia (639), Xinjiang (497) and Hebei (383) made top three in the list and combined accounted for 33.3% of total net increase in project entries since the same period last year; by net increase in investments of project entries, Guizhou (RMB 784.8 billion), Inner Mongolia (RMB563.1 billion) and Hebei (RMB 515.3 billion) were top three provinces and combined accounted for 32.2% of total net increase in investments since the same period last year.

(III) High industry concentration 

PPP projects and investment amount of all industries in the project database as of the end of March are shown in Figure 2-3-1 and Figure 2-3-2. Three industries, i.e. municipal works (4,333), transportation (1,511) and tourism (748), ranked among top three by number of projects and combined accounted for 53.7% of total project entries; such three industries as transportation (RMB 4,357.3 billion), municipal works (RMB 4,034.7 billion) and integrated urban development (RMB 1,442.1 billion) made top three in the list by total investments and combined accounted for 67.1% of total investments of project entries. 

Figure 2-3-1 Breakdown of number of project entries as of the end of March by industry

Figure 2-3-2 Breakdown of investment amounts of project entries as of the end of March by industry (in RMB100 million)

Industrial increases in national total over the previous month are shown in Figure 2-3-3 and Figure 2-3-4. Three industries, i.e. municipal works (178), transportation (77) and ecological construction and environmental protection (45), had greater net increases in projects and combined accounted for 59.6% of total net increase in the current month; such three industries as transportation (RMB 292.1 billion), municipal works (RMB 156.2 billion) and tourism (RMB 91.2 billion) had greater net increases in investment amount and combined accounted for 88.2% of total net increase in the current month.

 

Figure 2-3-3 Breakdown of net increase in project entries in the current month by industry (Nr.)

Figure 2-3-4 Breakdown of net increase in investment amount in the current month by industry (in RMB 100 million)

As shown in Figure 2-3-5 and Figure 2-3-6, compared to last year, such three industries as municipal works (335), transportation (136) and ecological construction and environmental protection (110) had greater net increases in projects and combined took up 56.6% of total net increase this quarter. Such three industries as transportation (RMB 400 billion), municipal works (RMB 254.6 billion) and tourism (RMB 176.4 billion) had greater net increases in quarterly investment amount and combined took up 77.8% of total net increase this quarter.

Figure 2-3-5 Breakdown of increases in projects of all industries in Q1 (Nr.)

Figure 2-3-6 Breakdown of increase in project investments of all industries in Q1 (in RMB100 million)

Compared with the same period last year, such three industries as municipal works (2,276), transportation (622) and tourism (311) had greater net increases in projects and combined accounted for 70.3% of total net increase since the same period last year. Such three industries as transportation (RMB 1,873 billion), municipal works (RMB 1,805.8 billion) and integrated urban development (RMB 583.2 billion) had greater net increases in investment amount and combined accounted for 73.6% of total net increase since the same period last year.

(IV) Accelerated project implementation 

The number of projects in preparation, procurement and implementation stages in Q1 is shown in figure 2-4-1. At the end of March, the implementation rate was 34.5%, an increase of 1.4 percentage points over the previous month, 2.9 percentage points over the previous year and 12.8 percentage points over the same period last year. 

Figure 2-4-1 Movements chart of projects and implementation rate of project entries by stage in Q1

At the end of March, the number of projects in the implementation stage was 1,729, an increase of 207 implemented projects over the previous month, or 13.6%; 378 implemented ones over the previous year, or an increase of 28.0% and 1,360 implemented ones over the same period last year, or an increase of 368.6%. Viewing from geographical distribution of implemented projects, top three regions in terms of implemented projects in the current month were Shandong (including Qingdao) with 279, Xinjiang with 173 and Henan with 114 respectively, combined accounting for 32.7% in all of total implemented projects. From monthly increase in terms of geographical distribution of implemented projects , Henan, Sichuan and Hunan ranked top three with respect to the net implemented project increase in the current month, with respectively 23, 20 and 16 projects, combined representing 28.5% in all of total net implemented projects increase in the current month. From quarterly increase in terms of geographical distribution of implemented projects, top three regions in terms of the net increase in the current quarter were Shandong (including Qingdao) with 57 projects, Henan 37 and Sichuan 29 respectively, combined accounting for 32.5% in all of total net implemented projects increase in the current quarter. Compared to the same period last year, three provinces with the largest increase in the number of implemented projects were Shandong (including Qingdao), Xinjiang and Henan, with 168, 165 and 95 projects respectively, combined representing 31.5% in total of the increase. 

Viewing from geographical distribution of investment in implemented projects, the project investment in the implementation stage at the end of March was RMB 2,870.5 billion, an increase of RMB 436.7 billion or 17.9% over the previous month; RMB 636.9 billion or 28.5% over the previous year and RMB 2,356.7 billion or 458.7% year on year. Viewing from geographical distribution of investment in implemented projects, Shandong (including Qingdao), Guizhou and Hebei ranked top three at RMB 345.8 billion, RMB 269.1 billion and RMB 220.4 billion respectively, combined accounting for 29.1% in all of total investment in implemented projects. Viewing from geographical distribution of investment in implemented projects, Shandong (including Qingdao), Henan and Shaanxi ranked top three at RMB 129.6 billion, RMB 50.8 billion and RMB 36.8 billion respectively, combined accounting for 49.7% in all of total investment in implemented projects. From quarterly increase in respect of geographical distribution of investment in implemented projects, Shandong (including Qingdao), Henan and Shaanxi ranked top three both in terms of net increase in the current quarter and monthly increase, with the increased amount of RMB 153.1 billion, RMB 61 billion and RMB 48.8 billion respectively, combined accounting for 41.3% in all of total net implemented projects increase in the current quarter. Compared to the same period last year,, three provinces with the largest increase in the investment in implemented projects were Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), and Hebei, with 2,593, 2,386 and 1,851 projects respectively, combined representing 29.0% in total of the increase. 

The geographical distribution of implemented projects and investment at the end of March is shown in figures 2-4-2 and 2-4-3. 

 

Figure 2-4-2 Geographical distribution of implemented projects as of the end of March (Nr.)

Figure 2-4-3 Geographical distribution of investment in implemented projects as of the end of March (in RMB 100 million)

 

At the end of March, top five industries in terms of the number of implemented projects remained municipal works, transportation, ecological construction and environmental protection, integrated urban development and education. As shown in figure 2-4-4, the “weight” statistics on implemented project industries for top five provinces in respect of implemented projects indicated that municipal works is the primary industry for PPP of each province. 

 

Figure 2-4-4 “Weight” distribution of industries of top five provinces in implemented projects

According to industry analysis, top three industries in terms of the number of implemented projects at the end of March were municipal works, transportation, as well as ecological construction and environmental protection, with 759, 223 and 123 projects respectively, combined representing 63.9% in all of total implemented projects. Top three industries in terms of the investment in implemented projects were municipal works, transportation and integrated urban development, standing at RMB 1,160.2 billion, RMB 784.6 billion and RMB 250.2 billion respectively, combined accounting for 76.5% in all of total investment in implemented projects. The industrial distribution of implemented projects and investment as of the end of March is shown in figures 2-4-5 and 2-4-6. 

Figure 2-4-5 Industrial distribution of implemented projects as of the end of March (Nr.)

 

Figure 2-4-6 Industrial distribution of implemented project investment as of the end of March (in RMB 100 million)

Compared to the end of previous month, top three industries in terms of net implemented projects increase in the current month were municipal works, transportation, as well as ecological construction and environmental protection, with 93, 21 and 18 projects respectively, combined representing 63.8% in all of total net projects increase in the current month. Top three industries with regard to net investment increase in implemented projects were municipal works, integrated urban development and transportation, standing at RMB 297.8 billion, RMB 36 billion and RMB 30.6 billion respectively, combined accounting for 83.4% in all of total net increase in the current month. 

Compared to the end of previous year, top three industries in respect of net implemented projects increase in this quarter were municipal works, transportation, as well as ecological construction and environmental protection, with 160, 37 and 30 projects respectively, combined representing 60.1% in all of total net projects increase in the quarter. Top three industries with regard to net implemented investment increase were municipal works, integrated urban development and transportation, standing at RMB 380.6 billion, RMB 66.7 billion and RMB 41.6 billion respectively, combined accounting for 76.8% in all of total net increase in this quarter. 

Compared to the same period previous year, top three industries in respect of net implemented projects increase were municipal works, transportation and integrated urban development, with 648, 189 and 79 projects respectively, combined representing 67.4% in all of total net projects increase since the same period last year. Top three industries with regard to net implemented investment increase were municipal works, transportation and integrated urban development, standing at RMB 950.4 billion, RMB 730.9 billion and RMB 197 billion respectively, combined accounting for 79.7% in all of total net increase since the same period last year. 

Among implemented projects as of the end of March, municipal works projects were dominated by wastewater treatment, municipal roads and waste disposal, with 198, 167 and 58 implemented projects and investment amounts of RMB72,7 billion, RMB 221.7 billion and RMB 18.9 billion, respectively, combined accounting for 55.7% and 27.0% in all of total implemented projects and investment amount of municipal works respectively; transportation one were dominated by Grade I highway, expressway and Grade II highway, with 69, 63 and 25 implemented projects and investment amounts of RMB 112.2 billion, RMB 568.8 billion and RMB 15.1 billion, respectively, combined accounting for 70.4% and 88.7% in all of total implemented projects and investments of transportation respectively; ecological construction and environmental protection projects were dominated by comprehensive treatment, with 95 implemented projects and investment of RMB 119 billion, accounting combined for 77.2% and 81.4% of total implemented projects and investments of ecological construction and environmental protection projects. 

(V) Investment in government-pay and variabilitygap subsidies projects accounts for nearly 70%

According to statistics by three return mechanism, as of the end of March, 4,833 user-pay projects with an investment of RMB 4.8 trillion represented 39.3% and 33.1% of total project entries and investments respectively; 4,053 government-pay projects with an investment of RMB 3.7 trillion represented 33.0% and 25.8% of total project entries and investments respectively; 3,401 variability gap subsidies (i.e. government-and-user-pay) projects with an investment of RMB 6.0 trillion represented 27.7% and 41.1% of total project entries and investments respectively, with detailed entries shown in figures 2-5-1 and 2-5-2. 

  

Figure 2-5-1 Breakdown of project entries as of the end of March by return mechanism (Nr.)Figure 2-5-2 Breakdown of investment in project entries as of the end of March by return mechanism (in RMB 100 million)

The shares of projects and investments in each month of this quarter, at the end of previous year and in the same period previous year by three returnmichanisms are shown in figures 2-5-3 and 2-5-4, respectively. It can be seen that the shares of government-pay and variability gap subsidies project entries were basically on a slight rise month-by-month and quarter-by-quarter, while the change trend of the share of user-pay project entries on the contrary. 

Figure 2-5-3 Comparison of shares of project entries by return mechanism

Figure 2-5-4 Comparison of shares of investment in project entries by return mechanism

Compared to the end of previous month, the number of net project entries increase of user-pay, government-pay and variability gap subsidies projects was 50, 273 and 180, with a net investment increase of RMB 108.8 billion, RMB 280.7 billion and RMB 221.8 billion respectively; compared to the end of previous year, the number of net project entries increase of user-pay, government-pay and variability gap subsidies projects was 146, 462 and 419, with a net investment increase of RMB 225 billion, RMB 387.6 billion and RMB 456 billion respectively; compared to the same period previous year, the number of net project entries increase of user-pay, government-pay and variability gap subsidies projects was 1,162, 1,842 and 1,562, with a net investment increase RMB 1,200.5 billion, RMB 1,815.5 billion and RMB 2,772 billion respectively. 

According to statistics of implemented projects, 442 user-pay projects with an investment of RMB 520.8 billion represented 25.6% and 18.1% of total implemented projects and investments respectively; 697 government-pay projects with an investment of RMB 850.9 billion represented 40.3% and 29.6% of total implemented projects and investments respectively; 590 variability gap subsidies projects with an investment of RMB 1,498.7 billion represented 34.1% and 52.2% of total implemented projects and investments respectively, as shown in figures 2-5-5 and 2-5-6. 

Figure 2-5-5 Comparison of statistics of implemented project entries in Q1 by return mechanism 

Figure 2-5-6 Comparison of statistics of implemented project entries in Q1 by return mechanism (in RMB 100 million)

Compared to the end of previous month, the number of net implemented projects increase of user-pay, government-pay and variability gap subsidies projects in the current month was 24, 94 and 89, with a net implemented investment increase of RMB 45.9 billion, RMB 113 billion and RMB 227.9 billion respectively; compared to the end of previous year, the number of net implemented projects increase of user-pay, government-pay and variability gap subsidies projects in the current quarter was 77, 163 and 138, with a net implemented investment increase of RMB 63.7 billion, RMB 188.9 billion and RMB 384.3 billion respectively; compared to the same period previous year, the number of net implemented projects increase of user-pay, government-pay and variability gap subsidies projects was 304, 575 and 481, with a net implemented investment increase of RMB 365.6 billion, RMB 724.3 billion and RMB 1,266.7 billion respectively. 

(VI) Green and low-carbon projects receive attention

PPP projects in a number of fields, including public transportation, water supply and drainage, ecological construction and environmental protection, water conservancy, renewable energy, education, science and technology, culture, senior care, healthcare, forestry and tourism, play a role in promoting a green and low-carbon economic structure. According to such a criterion, there were 7,220 green and low-carbon projects among national total with an investment of RMB 5.9 trillion as of the end of March, accounting for 58.8% and 40.7% of national total respectively. Compared to the end of previous month, the net project entries increase stood at 274 with a net investment increase of RMB 215.3 billion, and took up a stable share in national total. Compared to the end of previous year, net project entries increase stood at 608 with a net investment increase of RMB464.2 billion, and took up a stable share in national total. For comparison of green and low-carbon projects and investment at each stage in Q1, see figures 2-6-1 and 2-6-2. 

 

Figure 2-6-1 Comparison of green and low-carbon projects by stage in Q1 (Nr.)

Figure 2-6-2 Comparison of investment in green and low-carbon projects by stage in Q1 (in RMB 100 million)

As of the end of March, the signed implemented green and low-carbon projects totaled 1,012, with an investment of RMB 1,192.2 billion, accounting for 58.5% and 41.5% of national total respectively. Net implemented projects increase in the current month totaled 124 with a net implemented investment increase of RMB 252.1 billion, compared to the end of previous month. Net implemented projects increase reached 220 with a net implemented investment increase of RMB 362.6 billion, compared to the end of previous year.

msgPlace: Quarterly Report on the Project Database of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform （No.5）
title: Quarterly Report on the Project Database of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform （No.5）
txt:
Note:English version for reference only,Chinese version shall prevail.

Summary

In order to promote the project management, information disclosure and transaction, the Project Database of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform was put into operation officially in early 2016 for purposes of improving the governments' management level of PPP projects and broadening the channels through which the governments service the markets and the society by using "Internet plus" and big data. The results of the one-year operation have shown that innovating government management modes and means is an important guarantee for the successful implementation of PPP reform.

As of the end of December 2016, there were 743 national demonstration projects in total, with the investment reaching RMB 1.86 trillion. Among them, 363 projects was signed and put into implementation with investment of RMB 938 billion; the average implementation rate was 49.7%, with the implementation rates for the first, second and third batches of demonstration projects being 100%, 62.4% and 42.9% respectively; and the number of demonstration projects signed and to be implemented nationwide increased on a monthly basis. In terms of industries, municipal engineering projects signed and to be implemented ranked first in number, followed by the transportation ones and environmental protection and ecological construction ones; in terms of regions, Shandong Province ranked first in number, followed by Henan Province and Hebei Province. The average cycle for concluding a PPP project contract was 12.8 months, 0.7 month shorter compared to the end of June; and the average cycle for concluding a PPP project contract with respect to the third batch of demonstration projects was 11 months, 4 months shorter than that for the first two bathes of projects. The participation rate of social capital reached 39%, 3 percentage points higher than that at the end of June.

As of the end of December, the projects included in the database nationwide reached 11,260 in total, with investment of RMB 13.5 trillion. Specifically, there were 1,351 projects signed and put into implementation, with investment of RMB 2.2 trillion and implementation rate of 31.6%. The numbers of projects included in the database and put into implementation nationwide showed a month-by-month upward trend respectively. In terms of industries, projects in the municipal engineering, transportation and comprehensive urban development took up the first three places in the number of projects included in the database, accounting for 54% of all the projects included in the database; in terms of regions, Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao City), Xinjiang, Sichuan and Inner Mongolia ranked top five, with projects accounting for 48.0% of all the projects included in the database. The projects put into implementation in Shandong (including Qingdao City) accounted for 16.4% of all the projects put into implementation nationwide, topping all the other regions; the second and third places went to Xinjiang and Zhejiang respectively. In terms of the project return mechanism, the proportions of projects with government payments and viability gap funding in the whole year increased step by step.

The PPP reform has helped implement the new concepts of development, made the economic structure green and low-carbon, improved the quality and efficiency of the inter-city transport infrastructure development and economy, promoted co-building and sharing of public services, and enhanced the efficiency and quality of supply. As of the end of December, the green and low-carbon projects included in the database accounted for 58.7%, among which there were 792 projects signed and put into implementation with the investment of RMB 829.6 billion. Specifically, 186 projects were on the transportation sector, with the investment amounting to RMB 742.9 billion; and 115 projects were on the education, medical care and elderly care sectors in third and fourth tier cities, with the investment of RMB 80.6 billion.

Achieving cost-effectiveness and doing more things that really benefit the people is the value-for-money (VFM) goal of PPP projects. According to the analysis of 335 national demonstration projects passing the VFM quantitative evaluation in 2016, during the full project life cycle, about RMB 380 million was saved for each project on average in terms of government investment by using the PPP model, compared with the traditional investment and financing models.

Text

The Ministry of Finance established the National PPP Integrated Information Platform and project database (hereinafter referred to as the "project database"), and included all the projects intending to use and using the PPP model nationwide in the project database according to the requirements on examination and approval set out in the Circular on Regulating the Operation of PPP Integrated Information Platform (Cai Jin [2015] No.166), aiming to promote project management, information disclosure and transcation. The project database was officially put into operation at the beginning of 2016, and as of the end of December, there were 11,260 projects included in the project database nationwide, with the investment of RMB 13.5 trillion. Among them, 1,351 projects were signed and put into implementation with the investment of RMB 2.2 trillion; and there were 743 national demonstration projects, with the investment reaching RMB1.86 trillion.

This report includes the basic information on the project database as at the end of December, the changes regarding the projects included in the database in 2016, and PPPs' contributions in implementing the new concepts of development. The specific contents are as follows.

I.     Basic Information on the Project Database as at the End of December

(I)    National demonstration projects

As at the end of December 2016, there were 743 national demonstration projects, with the investment reaching RMB1.86 trillion. Specifically, the number of projects in the first batch in 2014 was 22 (originally 30, and 6 were canceled in succession, and another 2 will be canceled), with the investment of RMB 70.9 billion; the number of projects in the second batch in 2015 was 205 (originally 206, and one was canceled), with the investment of RMB 626.7 billion; and the number of projects in the third batch was 516, with the investment of RMB 1.17 trillion.

1.    Demonstration projects have shown clearer lighthouse and exemplary effects

The whole life cycle of a PPP project includes five stages, i.e., identification, preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer. At the end of January and December 2016 respectively, the numbers and total investment of the three batches of demonstration projects in those five stages are shown in Figures 1-1-1 and 1-1-2. In October 2016, the third batch of demonstration projects was published, and the number and investment of the projects increased substantially compared with the first two batches, so the numbers and investment of demonstration projects in different stages at the end of the year also changed greatly. In general, the number and investment of projects in the identification stage dropped slightly at the end of December, while the number and investment of projects in the implementation stage increased significantly.

As at the end of December, there were 363 demonstration projects signed and put into implementation, showing an increase of 297 projects compared with the end of January; and the investment of the said 363 projects amounted to RMB 938 billion, increasing by RMB 723.4 billion compared with the end of January. Specifically, 22, 121 and 220 demonstration projects in the first, second and third batches, respectively, were put into implementation.

Figure 1-1-1 Comparison of numbers of demonstration projects in each stage at the end of January and December

Figure 1-1-2 Comparison of investments of demonstration projects in each stage at the end of January and December

The project implementation rate refers to the ratio between the sum of the numbers of the projects in the implementation and transfer stages and the sum of the numbers of the projects in the preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer stages. According to the statistics made by such definition, the implementation rate of demonstration project at the end of December was 49.7%. Specifically, the implementation rates for the first, second and third batches were 100%, 62.4% and 42.9%, respectively, as shown in Figure 1-1-3.

Figure 1-2-3 Implementation rates of the first, second and third batches of demonstration projects at the end of December

2.    Areas and sectors covered by demonstration projects continued to expand

The first batch of demonstration projects covered 11 provinces and 4 sectors, the second batch 28 provinces and 16 sectors, and the third batch 30 provinces and 18 sectors.

The numbers of demonstration projects and the numbers of projects signed and to be implemented as at the end of December in all regions are shown in Figure 1-1-4.Shandong has 37 demonstration projects signed and to be implemented, ranking first in China, followed by Henan (31), Hebei (26), Anhui (21) and Yunnan (20).

Figure 1-1-4 Comparison of the numbers of demonstration projects and the numbers of projects signed and to be implemented as at the end of December in all regions

The project database includes 19 primary industries, such as energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, comprehensive urban development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical care and public health, elderly care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructure and others.

The numbers of demonstration projects and the numbers of projects signed and to be implemented as at the end of December in all industries are shown in Figure 1-1-5.

Figure 1-1-5 Comparison of the numbers of demonstration projects and the numbers of projects signed and to be implemented as at the end of December in all industries

Among the 363 demonstration projects signed and to be implemented, the number of municipal engineering projects was 180, accounting for 50% and maintaining the first place since May; the number of transport projects was 37, accounting for 10%; the number of ecological construction and environmental protection projects was 30, accounting for 8%; the number of water conservancy construction projects was 21, accounting for 6%; and the number of education, medical care and elderly care projects in total was 36, accounting for 10%. See Figure 1-1-6.

Figure 1-1-6 Industrial distribution of demonstration projects signed and to be implemented at the end of December

3.    The cycle for concluding a PPP project contract was shortened continuously

The cycle for concluding a PPP project refers to the time actually taken from the initiation of a project to the signing of the PPP project contract. Regulating the operating procedures for the initiation, preparation and procurement in respect of a PPP project with sufficient time for concluding the relevant contract will lay a solid foundation for building and operation. Considering the time necessary for early-stage preparation and acquisition of socialcapital regarding a project, here we only set out the analysis of 247 demonstration projects signed and to be implemented with a cycle for concluding the project contract of not less than 6 months on the basis of the information shown in the project database. According to the statistics, the cycles for concluding contracts for all projects are between 6 to 51 months, as shown in Figure 1-1-7. The average cycle for concluding the contract of each project is 12.8 months, 0.7 month shorter compared with the figure of 13.5 months for 53 demonstration projects at the end of June.

Figure 1-1-7 Distribution of cycles for concluding PPP project contracts of 247 demonstration projects

For comparison of the average cycle for concluding a contract of each batch of national demonstration projects at the end of December, the average cycle for concluding a contract for the 20 demonstration projects in the first batch is 15.0 months, for the 83 demonstration projects in the second batch 15.6 months, and for the 144 demonstration projects in the third batch 11.0 months, which is 4 months shorter than the time used for the first and second batches.

With the advance of PPP projects, all related parties had their competency improved and experience accumulated; therefore, the cycle for concluding a project was shortened with higher efficiency.

(II)   Projects included in the database nationwide

1.    The numbers of projects included in the database and those to be implemented continued to increase

As at the end of December 2016, there were 11,260 projects included in the database nationwide, with the total investment of RMB 13.5 trillion. Specifically, 6,987 projects were in the identification stage, with the total investment of RMB 6.7 trillion; 1,936 in the preparation stage, with the total investment of RMB 3 trillion; 986 in the procurement stage, with the total investment of RMB 1.5 trillion; 1,351 in the implementation stage, with the total investment of RMB 2.2 trillion; and there was no project in the transfer stage. As at the end of December, the implementation rate for the projects included in the database nationwide was 31.6%, with steady growth in the number of projects in the process of implementation and in the implementation rate as compared with the implementation rates of 19.6%, 21.7%, 23.8% and 26.0% at the end of January, March, June and September, respectively.

2.    Projects included in the database concentrated in certain regions

In terms of the number of projects included in the database, the top five provinces (autonomous regions) were Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Xinjiang, Sichuan and Inner Mongolia, whose specific numbers were 1,788, 1,087, 852, 848 and 828, respectively, altogether accounting for 48.0% of the total number of projects included in the database. In terms of investment in the projects included in the database, Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Yunnan, Henan, and Sichuan ranked the top five, with the investment of RMB1.6034 trillion, RMB 1.2229 trillion, RMB 1.0302 trillion, RMB 953.8 billion, and RMB 918 billion, altogether accounting for 42.4% of the total investment of the projects included in the database.

See Figures 1-2-1 and 1-2-2 for comparison of the numbers and investment of projects included in the project database in all regions at the end of December and January 2016.

Figure 1-2-1 Regional distribution of the numbers of projects included in the database at the end of December

Figure 1-2-2 Regional distribution of the investment of projects included in the database at the end of December (RMB 100 million)

At the end of December, there were 1,351 projects in the implementation stage, increasing by 361% compared with 1,058 projects at the end of January. In terms of the regional distribution of projects in the process of implementation, there were 222 projects in Shandong (including Qingdao), accounting for 16.4% of all the projects put into implementation; 146 in Xinjiang, accounting for 10.8% and ranking second; then, 88 in Zhejiang, 81 in Sichuan and 77 in Henan. In terms of the regional distribution for investment of the projects put into implementation, Guizhou, Hebei, Shandong (including Qingdao), Beijing and Yunnan ranked the top five, with the investment of RMB 265.6 billion, RMB 211.4 billion, RMB 192.7 billion, RMB 174.3 billion, and RMB 148.8 billion, altogether accounting for 44.4% of the total investment of the projects put into implementation. The regional distribution for the numbers and investment of projects put into implementation at the end of December is shown in Figures 1-2-3 and 1-2-4.

Figure 1-2-3 Regional distribution for the numbers of projects put into implementation at the end of December

Figure 1-2-4 Regional distribution for the investment of projects put into implementation at the end of December (RMB 100 million)

3.    The industries of municipal engineering, transportation and comprehensive urban development took lead in the project database

See Figures 1-2-5 and 1-2-6 for the numbers and investment of PPP projects in different industries as at the end of December. In particular, municipal engineering, transportation and comprehensive urban development ranked the top three in terms of both the number of projects and investment, accounting for 54% and 68% of the total number and investment of projects included in the database, respectively.

See Figures 1-2-7 and 1-2-8 for the regional distribution for the numbers and investment of new projects included in the database as compared with the end of January. Specifically, there were more new projects in the industries of municipal engineering, transportation, tourism and comprehensive urban development, with the numbers being 2,170, 614, 307 and 221, respectively; and new investment in the industries of transportation, municipal engineering, comprehensive urban development and tourism grew substantially, amounting to RMB 1.7232 trillion, RMB 1.719 trillion, RMB 498.9 billion and RMB 288.2 billion, respectively.

Figure 1-2-5 Industrial distribution for the numbers of projects included in the database at the end of December

Figure 1-2-6 Industrial distribution for the investment of projects included in the database at the end of December (RMB 100 million)

Figure 1-2-7 Industrial distribution for numbers of new projects included into the database at the end of December as compared with the end of January

Figure 1-2-8 Industrial distribution for new investment at the end of December as compared with the end of January (RMB 100 million)

4.    Proportions of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding increased gradually

According to the statistics by three return mechanisms, as at the end of December, there were 4,687 projects with user payments and the investment therein totaled RMB 4.6 trillion, accounting for 42% of all the projects included in the database and 34% of the total investment, respectively; there were 3,591 projects with government payments and the investment therein totaled RMB 3.37 trillion, accounting for 32% and 25% respectively; and, there were 2,982 projects with viability gap funding and the investment therein totaled RMB 5.52 trillion, accounting for 26% and 41%, respectively, as shown in Figures 1-2-9 and 1-2-10. The proportion of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding together increased gradually throughout the year to around 60%, while the proportion of user-payment projects decreased step by step to about 40%.

Figure 1-2-9 Distribution of numbers of projects included in the database by return mechanism at the end of December

Figure 1-2-10 Distribution of investment of projects included in the database by return mechanism at the end of December (RMB 100 million)

II. Changes in the Projects Included in the Database in 2016

(I) Changes in the implementation rates of national demonstration projects

Figure 2-1-1 shows the changes in the implementation rates of national demonstration projects. From January to September, the implementation rates of demonstration projects were on the rise steadily. In October, the data on the third batch of demonstration projects was included in the calculation, thus resulting in the slight decline in the implementation rate; however, the implementation rate has increased steadily since November.

Figure 2-1-1 Changes in the implementation rates of national demonstration projects

(II) Changes in the scale of projects included in the database nationwide

The projects increased from 6,997 with the investment of RMB 8.1 trillion at the beginning of 2016 to 11,260 with the investment of RMB 13.5 trillion at the end of the year, showing substantial rise in both the number of projects and investment by 61% and 66% respectively, as well as a month-by-month upward trend, as shown in Figures 2-2-1 and 2-2-2. The growth has slowed down since the end of July.

Figure 2-2-1 Monthly change in the number of projects included in the database in different stages

Figure 2-2-2 Monthly change in the investment of projects included in the database in different stages (RMB 1 trillion)

(III) Changes in the implementation of projects included in the database nationwide

The number of projects put into implementation and the implementation rate in China increased steadily in general, as shown in Figures 2-3-1 and 2-3-2.

Figure 2-3-1 Number of projects put into implementation in each month of 2016

Figure 2-3-2 Changes in the implementation rate in each month of 2016

III. PPPs' Contributions in Implementing the New Concepts of Development

(I) Upholding the concept of green and low-carbon life to facilitate the structural optimization through PPPs

The PPP projects in various sectors including public transport, water supply and drainage, ecological construction and environmental protection, water conservancy construction, renewable energy, education, science and technology, culture, elderly care, medical care, forestry and tourism have played the role of making the economic structure green and low-carbon. On such a basis, as at the end of December, there were 6,612 green and low-carbon projects included in the database nationwide, with the investment of RMB 5.5 trillion, accounting for 58.7% of all the projects included in the database nationwide and 40.5% of the total investment of the same respectively. Specifically, there were 792 projects signed and to be implemented, with the investment of RMB 829.6 billion; compared with the end of January, there were 581 new projects put into implementation, with additional investment of RMB 557 billion, and the implementation rate increased from 23% at the end of January to 32%. See Figures 3-1-1 and 3-1-2 for comparison of the numbers and investment of green and low-carbon projects at the end of December and January 2016.

Figures 3-1-1 Comparison of the numbers of green and low-carbon projects at the end of December and January 2016

Figures 3-1-2 Comparison of the investment of green and low-carbon projects at the end of December and January 2016 (RMB 100 million)

(III) Facilitating the expansion of inter-city transport infrastructure to help improve the quality and efficiency of economic development through PPPs

Transportation is an important aspect of the interconnection between inter-city infrastructure. The PPP projects in the transportation sector have always ranked top, and as at the end of December, there were 1,375 projects included in the database nationwide, with the investment of RMB 4 trillion. Specifically, there were 186 projects signed and to be implemented, with the investment of RMB 742.9 billion; compared with the end of March, there were 152 new projects put into implementation, with additional investment of RMB 689.2 billion, and the implementation rate increased from 14.7% at the end of March to 31.2%.See Figures 3-2-1 and 3-2-2 for comparison of the numbers and investment of transportation projects at the end of December and March 2016. With further development and implementation of PPP projects in the transportation sector, the PPP model will play a more important role in enhancing the interconnection between inter-city infrastructure to help improve the quality and efficiency of economic development.

Figure 3-2-1 Comparison of the numbers of PPP projects in transportation sector at the end of December and March

Figure 3-2-2 Comparison of the investment of PPP projects in transportation sector at the end of March and December (RMB 100 million)

(III) Improving public service capacity of third and fourth tier cities with a focus on shoring up the weaknesses in public services through PPPs

Preliminary analysis was made regarding the PPP model's contributions to the relevant sectors in third and fourth tier cities on the statistical basis of the projects included in the database in the sectors of education, medical care and elderly care excluding those in the first and second tier cities as well as the districts under the jurisdiction thereof. As there has no official classification for first, second, third and fourth tier cities currently, we use the classification set out in the List of Chinese Cities for Business Charm in 2016 released in April 2016 by the Institute for New First-tier Cities, the data and news project under CBNWeekly, and there are 49 first and second tier cities altogether.

As at the end of December, there were 1,237 projects in the sectors of education, medical care and elderly care in the third and fourth tier cities, with the investment of RMB 565.6 billion; the respective numbers of projects in the identification, preparation, procurement and implementation are shown in Figure 3-3-1.Specifically, 115 projects were signed and put into implementation with the investment of RMB 80.6 billion. Compared with the end of March, there were 75 new projects put into implementation in those three sectors, with additional investment of RMB 45.5 billion, and the implementation rate increased from 18.0% at the end of March to 24.8%.

Figure 3-3-1 Numbers of projects in sectors of education, medical care and elderly care in different stages at the end of December and March

(IV) Enhancing the participation of private enterprises to stimulate the vitality of the market through PPPs

In terms of the types of corporate partners: as at the end of December, the information on the contracting socialcapital for 277 demonstration projects signed and to be implemented was input into the database, including 175 single-private-capital projects and 102 consortium projects; there were 419 contracting corporatepartners in total, including 104 wholly-privately-owned enterprises, 59 privately-controlled ones, 16 Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan companies, 6 foreign-funded companies, 119 state-owned enterprises, and 113 state-controlled enterprises, as well as a fund company and a listed company for which it is difficult to identify their types. The number of private enterprises (including wholly-privately-owned and privately-controlled ones) reached 163, accounting for more than 39% (as shown in Figure 3-4-1), 3 percentage points higher than the result obtained based on the statistics of 82 demonstration projects at the end of June.

Figure 3-4-1 Categories and proportions of 419 corporate partners

In terms of demonstration projects with different categories of corporate partners: the numbers of projects with corporate partners that are private enterprises, consortiums consisting of private and foreign-funded enterprises, foreign capital, state capital and consortiums excluding private and foreign-funded enterprises were 77, 62, 13, 85, and 40, respectively. The number of projects with capital from private companies and consortiums consisting of private and foreign-funded enterprises reached 139, accounting for 50% (as shown in Figure 3-4-2), 11 percentage points higher than the result obtained based on the statistics of 82 demonstration projects at the end of June.

Figure 3-4-2 Numbers of 277 projects and proportions by the categories of corporate partners

The proportion of investment in projects with capital from private enterprises and consortiums consisting of private and foreign-funded enterprises together reached 45%, as shown in Figure 3-4-3.

Figure 3-4-3 Investment of 277 projects and proportions by the categories of corporate partners

In terms of the sectors where private enterprises have made investments: 139 projects with capital from private enterprises and consortiums consisting of private and foreign-owned companies covered 13 sectors. Specifically, the number of municipal engineering projects was the highest, being 63, followed by those of transportation and water conservancy construction projects, being 11 respectively, and then ecological construction and environmental protection projects (10), as shown in Figure 3-4-4. Compared with the results obtained based on the statistics of 82 demonstration projects at the end of June, private enterprises entered new PPP sectors including comprehensive urban development, tourism and culture. Private enterprises and consortiums consisting of private and foreign-owned companies were involved in more and more sectors.

Figure 3-4-4 Distribution of 139 projects with capital from private enterprises and foreign-owned companies in different sectors

(V)  Achieving the VFM effects and improving the efficiency of public service supply

Achieving cost-effectiveness and doing more things that really benefit the people is the VFM goal of PPP projects. At the end of December 2015, the Guidelines for VFM Evaluations of PPP (for Trial Implementation) (Cai Jin [2015] No.167) were issued. Therefore, we determined the scope of analysis to cover all the demonstration projects passing VFM quantitative evaluation in 2016; as at the end of December 2016, there were 335 qualified projects that had the information about their VFM quantitative evaluation input in the project database.

The indicator for passing the VFM quantitative evaluation is that the VFM value is greater than 0. The VFM value is the difference between the public sector comparative value (PSC value) as calculated by the reference project under the traditional investment and financing model and the net full-life-cycle cost (PPP value) of the government as calculated for the PPP project. The sum of the PSC values of the 335 demonstration projects was RMB 697.2 billion; the sum of PPP values was RMB 570.5 billion; and the sum of the government's planned investment was RMB 694.9 billion. The sum of PPP values is RMB 124.4 billion less than the sum of investment, about RMB 370 million less for each project on average; on the other hand, the sum of PPP values is RMB 126.7 billion less than the sum of PSC values, about RMB 380 million less for each project on average. All those indicate that compared with the traditional investment and financing model, the PPP model can help save government spending and improve the efficiency of public service supply.

According to the analysis in terms of the return mechanism, among the 335 demonstration projects, there are 61 user-payment, 99 government-payment and 175 viability gap funding projects, and the average VFM value for each project is RMB 240 million, RMB 270 million and RMB 490 million, respectively. Regardless of the return mechanism adopted, the PPP projects have achieved the VFM goal through open competition in the market.

msgPlace: Quarterly Report on the Project Library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform (No.4)
title: Quarterly Report on the Project Library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform (No.4)
txt:
Note:English version for reference only,Chinese version shall prevail.

Summary

According to the statistics from the National Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Integrated Information Platform established by the Ministry of Finance, as at the end of September 2016, the Ministry of Finance has approved two batches of demonstration projects (232 projects in total) , with a total investment of RMB 786.63 billion. Among those demonstration projects, 128 are in the process of implementation, with a total investment of RMB 345.6 billion; and the proportion of the PPP agreement signed is 58.2%. Compared with the situation at the end of June, the rate of the the PPP agreement signed for the first batch of demonstration projects did not show any change, while that for the second batch increased.

In terms of the situation around the country, the  demand for PPP projects continued to increase; at the end of September, there were 10,471 projects in the library, with a total investment of RMB 12.46 trillion; among them, 946 projects were reaching the implementation phase, with a total investment of RMB 1.56 trillion, which is spectacular; the the proportion of the PPP agreement signed was 26%, and compared with the situation at the end of June, the projects included in the library have been put into implementation more rapidly, that’s the reason why we see a stable growth of the rate. According to the analyses, the concentration ratios in terms of regions and industries of the projects included in the library are relative high; the projects in Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Xinjiang, Sichuan and Inner Mongolia ranked top five in terms of number, and altogether accounted for nearly half of the projects in the library; the projects in the industries of municipal engineering, transport and area development ranked top three in terms of sectors , totaling more than half of the projects in the library. In respect of the return mechanism, the proportion of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding increased by 5 percentages compared with the situation at the end of June. Considering the slight increase from March to June, the said proportion has been rising gradually.

Text

In 2015, the Ministry of Finance issued the Circular on Regulating the Operation of the Public-Private Partnership Integrated Information Platform (Cai Jin [2015] No.166), establishing the Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Integrated Information Platform and the project library. As at the end of September 2016, there have been 10,471 projects included in the PPP Integrated Information Platform upon review as required, with a total investment of RMB 12.46 trillion; among those projects, 946 were in the process of implementation, with a total investment amounting to RMB 1.56 trillion; 232 were the demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance , with a total investment of RMB 786.63 billion, including 128 in the process of implementation with a total investment of RMB 345.6 billion.

The specific information is shown as follows:

I. Information on Demonstration Projects of the Ministry of Finance

As at the end of September, 2016, the number of the first batch of PPP demonstration projects launched by the Ministry of Finance in 2014 was 26 (original 30, while 4 were canceled later); and the number of the second batch of demonstration projects in 2015 was 206; and the total number of demonstration projects reached 232, and the total investment amounted to RMB 786.63 billion. The total investment decreased by RMB 15.91 billion from the end of June, and the main reason is that as more projects entered the preparation stage from identification stage, the estimated investment for those projects became more accurate, and the amount of investment in the project library was changed accordingly.

1. Number of projects have their PPP agreement signed  increased significantly

The full lifecycle management of a PPP project includes five stages, i.e., identification, preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer. The current situation of the first two batches of demonstration projects as at the end of January, March, June and September is shown in Figures 1-1-1 and 1-1-2.

With respect to the demonstration projects entering the implementation phase, there were 66 at the end of January, with investment of RMB 214.6 billion; 73 at the end of March, with investment of RMB 226.7 billion; 105 at the end of June, with investment of RMB 307.8 billion; and 128 at the end of September, with investment of RMB 345.6 billion. 7 more projects had their contracts signed and put into implementation in the latter two months of the first quarter; 32 more projects in the second quarter; and 23 more projects in the third quarter; the number of demonstration project contracts signed and to be implemented grew significantly.

Figure 1-1-1 Comparison of numbers of demonstration projects in each phase at the end of January, March, June and September

 

Figure 1-1-2 Comparison of investments of demonstration projects in each phase at the end of January, March, June and September

2. The second batch of demonstration projects were put into implementation more rapidly

The proportion of the PPP agreement signed equals to the ratio between the total numbers of the projects in the implementation and transfer phases and the numbers of the projects in the preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer phases. By this criterion, the implementation rate of the two batches of demonstration projects at the end of September was 58.18%, up by 9.78 percentage from 48.40% at the end of June, as shown in Figure 1-2-1.


Figure 1-2-1 Changes in the proportion of the PPP agreement signed of the two batches ofdemonstration projects

At the end of September, 19 of the first batch demonstration projects entered the implementation phase, with the the proportion of the PPP agreement signed reaching 76%; there has been little change since the end of June, and the projects that have not finished their procurement were mainly those large rail transit projects which require longer time for preparation and procurement. 109 of the second batch have entered the implementation phase, which takes 56% of all the second batch projects; compared with the corresponding figures 89 and 45% at the end of June, there was a trend of more speedy start of implementation. For the specific information, see Figure 1-2-2.

  

Figure 1-2-2 Proportion of the PPP agreement signed of the first and second batches of demonstration projects at the end of September

3. Municipal engineering projects took lead in terms of number

Among the 128 demonstration projects signed and to be implemented, the number of municipal engineering projects was 62, accounting for 48%; the number of ecological construction and environmental protection projects was 12, accounting for 9%; the number of transport projects was 10, accounting for 8%; the number of water conservancy construction projects is 10, accounting for 8%; and the rest was 34, accounting for 27%. See Figure 1-3-1 for details. The total number of demonstration projects and the number of projects signed and to be implemented at the end of September in all industries are shown in figure 1-3-2.

 

Figure 1-3-1 Sectoral distribution of demonstration projects signed and to be implemented at the end of September

 

Figure 1-3-2 Comparison of the total number of demonstration projects and the number of projects signed and to be implemented at the end of September in all sectors

II. Projects in the Library

As at the end of September, there were 10,471 projects in the library, with a total investment of RMB 12.46 trillion, showing an increase of 1,186 projects and RMB1.86 trillion respectively from the end of June; among them, 946 projects were in the process of implementation, with a total investment reaching RMB 1.56 trillion, showing an increase of 327 projects and RMB 500 billion respectively from the end of June.

1. Total number of projects continued to increase, and projects to be implemented were supported by considerable investment

The total number of projects in the library at the end of each month and the number of project in each stage from January to September are shown in figure 2-1-1, and the investment amount in figure 2-1-2. The projects included in the library increased by 386 and RMB480 billion on average month by month, reflecting the increasing demand for PPP projects. It should be noted that about 70% of those projects were PPP project alternatives in the identification stage, because they were scheduled to be implemented in the coming years and the value for money (VFM) assessment and financial capacity demonstration were not completed yet. The figure just indicated that local government departments had the intention to use the PPP model; for those projects to become real PPPs, strict demonstration and examination is required. However, 946 projects were signed and to be implemented with RMB 1.56 trillion investments as at the end of September, showing still considerable investment in the project in the process of implementation.

 

Figure 2-1-1 Monthly change in the number of projects in different stages

 

Figure 2-1-2 Monthly change in the investment amount in projects in different stages (RMB 1 trillion)

2. Projects in the library were put into implementation more rapidly, with steady growth in the proportion of the PPP agreement signed

The projects in the implementation stage amounted to 298, 369, 619 and 946 at the end of January, March, June and September, respectively. 71 more projects were concluded and put into implementation in the latter two months of the first quarter, showing an increase of 23.8%; 250 more projects in the second quarter, showing an increase of 67.7%; and 327 more projects in the third quarter, showing an increase of 52.8%. The implementation rate kept rising substantially, which indicated that the projects in the library were put into implementation more rapidly.

The implementation rates were 20%, 22%, 24% and 26% at the end of January, March, June and September, respectively, showing a stable growth. The numbers of projects in the preparation, procurement or implementation stages at the end of January, March, June and September are shown in figure 2-2-1.

  

Figure 2-2-1 Distribution of projects in the preparation, procurement and implementation stages at the end of January, March, June and September

3. Projects in the library concentrated in certain regions

In terms of the number of projects in the library, the top five provinces (autonomous regions) were Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Xinjiang, Sichuan and Inner Mongolia, whose specific numbers were 1,725, 1,062, 816, 797 and 748, respectively, altogether accounting for 49.2% of the total number of projects in the library. In terms of investment in the projects included in the library, Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Yunnan, Henan, Sichuan and Hebei ranked the top six, with the investment of RMB1.5 trillion, RMB1.2 trillion, RMB 917.8 billion, RMB 871.7 billion, RMB 855.5 billion and RMB 667.5 billion, respectively, altogether accounting for 48.3% of the total investment of the projects included in the library.

Except that some projects in Ningxia were withdrawn from the library, more projects were entered the library in all the other areas from June to September. There were more new projects in Hebei, Jiangsu, Anhui and Jiangxi, being 106, 105, 95 and 72, respectively, accounting for 31.9% of the new projects nationwide. Jiangsu, Gansu, Guizhou, Hebei and Yunnan recorded larger investments in new projects of RMB 170 billion, RMB 161.7 billion, RMB 150.7 billion, RMB 135.5 billion and RMB 130 billion, respectively.

See Figures 2-3-1 and 2-3-2 for comparison of the number of projects and investment of different regions at the end of September and June. 

 

Figure 2-3-1 Regional distribution of the number of PPP projects


 

Figure 2-3-2 Regional distribution of the investment amounts in PPP projects (RMB100 million)

 

4. Projects included in the library concentrated in certain sectors

The project library includes projects in 19 primary industries: energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, area development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical care and public health, elderly care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructure and others. See the appendix for the introduction on industry classification. See Figures 2-4-1 and 2-4-2 for the numbers and investment amounts of PPP projects in different sectors. In particular, municipal engineering, transportation and area development ranked the top three in terms of both the number of projects and investment amount, accounting for 53.7% and 68.0% of the total number and investment of projects included in the library, respectively.

As compared with the end of March, there were more new projects in municipal engineering, transportation and area development, with the numbers being 459, 136 and 97, respectively; and new investment in municipal engineering, transportation and area development grew substantially, amounting to RMB 633.6 billion, RMB 386.2 billion and RMB 335.6 billion, respectively.

 

Figure 2-4-1 Sectoral distribution of numbers of PPP projects at the end of September


 

Figure 2-4-2 Sectoral distribution of investment amounts in PPP projects at the end of September (RMB 100 million)


 

Figure 2-4-3 Sectoral distribution of numbers of new projects at the end of September as compared with the end of June


 

Figure 2-4-4 Sectoral distribution of additional investment amounts at the end of September as compared with the end of June

The following is the introduction to numbers and investment amounts of municipal engineering projects, transportation projects and area development projects as at the end of September and comparison with the end of June.

1. Municipal engineering: 3,700 projects with total investment of RMB 3.42 trillion. In particular, there were 809,  616, 396 and 314 projects in four sub-sectors, i.e., sewage treatment, municipal roads, water supply and waste disposal, accounting for 57.7% of the total number of municipal engineering projects; investment amount in projects in three grade-2 industries, i.e., rail transit, municipal roads and pipeline networks  was larger, reaching RMB 1.24 trillion, RMB 540.2 billion and  RMB 376 billion, respectively, accounting for 63.1% of the total investment in municipal engineering projects.

As compared with the end of June, there were 459 new projects. Specifically, there were more new projects in five sub-sectors, i.e., municipal roads, sewage treatment, others, waste disposal and pipeline networks, with the numbers being 102, 69, 50, 37 and 30, accounting for 62.7% of all new projects. The new investment reached RMB 633.6 billion. Specifically, larger increases were shown in the investment in those five sub-sectors, i.e., rail transit, municipal roads, pipeline networks, sponge city construction and others, with the amounts being RMB 199.8 billion, RMB 140.8 billion, RMB 103 billion, RMB 53.8 billion and RMB 40.2 billion, accounting for 84.9% of the total new investment.

 

Figure 2-4-5 Comparison of numbers of municipal engineering projects under PPP model as at the end of September with those as at the end of June


 

Figure 2-4-6 Comparison of investments in municipal engineering projects under PPP model as at the end of September with those as at the end of June


2. Transportation: 1,268 projects with total investment of RMB 3.71 trillion. Specifically, the projects in four sub-sectors, i.e., first-class highways, expressways, second-class highways and others amount to 314, 242, 151 and 134, respectively, accounting for 66.3% of the total transportation projects; the investments in three sub-sectors, i.e., expressways, first-class highways and railways (excluding rail transit) amounted to RMB 2.06 trillion, RMB 599.8 billion and RMB 318.4 billion, respectively, accounting for 80.3% of the total investment of transportation projects.

As compared with the situation as at the end of June, there were 136 new projects. Specifically, there were as many as 46, 26 and 22 new projects in three grade sectors, i.e., first-class highways second-class highways and expressways, respectively, accounting for 69.1% of all new projects. The new investment amounted to RMB 386.2 billion. Specifically, the investments in two grade-2 industries, i.e., expressways and first-class highways, amounted to RMB 281.9 billion and RMB 92.6 billion, respectively, accounting for 97.0% of the total new investment.

 

Figure 2-4-7 Comparison of numbers of transportation projects under PPP model as at the end of September with those as at the end of June

 

Figure 2-4-8 Comparison of investments in transportation projects under PPP model as at the end of September with those as at the end of June

3. Area development: 651 projects with total investment of RMB1.34 trillion. Specifically, the numbers of projects in two sub-sectors, park development and urbanization, were 335 and 163, respectively, accounting for 76.5% of the total number of area development projects; the investments in those two sub-sectors grade-2 industries amounted to RMB 654.3 billion and RMB 508.8 billion, respectively, accounting for 86.3% of the total investment of area development projects.

As compared with the situation as at the end of June, there were 97 new projects, including 55 and 38 new projects in park development and urbanization, respectively; and the net increase in investment amounted to RMB 335.7 billion.

 

Figure 2-4-9 Comparison of numbers of area development projects under PPP model as at the end of September with those as at the end of June

 

Figure 2-4-10 Comparison of investments of area development projects under PPP model as at the end of September with those as at the end of June

5. Proportions of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding increased slightly

According to statistics by three return mechanisms, there were 4,518 projects with user charges and the investment therein totaled RMB 4.3 trillion, accounting for 43% of the total number of projects included in the library and 35% of the total investment, respectively; there were 3,214 projects with government payments and the investment therein totaled RMB 3 trillion, accounting for 31% and 24% respectively; and, there were 2,739 projects with viability gap funding and the investment therein totaled RMB 5.1 trillion, accounting for 26% and 41%, respectively.

As compared with the situation at the end of June, numbers of new projects with user pays, government payments and viability gap funding were 203, 471 and 512, respectively, with new investments of RMB 169.2 billion, RMB 625.4 billion and RMB 1.07 trillion, respectively.
