The proportion of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding increased by 5 percentage compared with the situation at the end of June. Considering the slight increase from March to June, the said proportion has been on the rise gradually.

  

Figure 2-5-1 Distribution of numbers of projects in the library by return mechanism at the end of SeptemberFigure 2-5-2 Distribution of investments in projects in the library by return mechanism at the end of September (RMB 100 million)

 

Figure 2-5-3 Comparison of numbers of projects calculated by return of mechanism at the end of September with those at the end of June

 

Figure 2-5-4 Comparison of investments calculated by return mechanism at the end of September with those at the end of June

 

Appendix:

Introduction to Sector Classification for Project Library

Based on the 13 sectors specified in the Circular of the General Office of the State Council on Forwarding the Guiding Opinions of the Ministry of Finance, National Development and Reform Commission and People's Bank of China on Promoting the Public-Private Partnership Model in the Public Services (Guo Ban Fa [2015] No.42), and upon full consideration of the sector classification standards adopted by the Department of Budget and the Department of Economic Construction, the China Public Private Partnerships Center has determined the industry classification for the project library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform, which consists of sectors and sub-sectors. 19 sectors include: energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, area development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical care and public health, elderly care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructure and others. In particular, according to the opinions of different parties, since March 2016, the sub-sectors of "sewage treatment" has been transferred from the industry of "ecological construction and environmental protection" to "municipal engineering".

Grade-1 industries in which there were larger numbers of projects in the PPP project library and investments are as follows:

1. Municipal engineering: including 18 grade-2 industries, i.e., water supply, water drainage, sewage treatment, power supply, gas supply, heat supply, cooling, parks, parking lots, squares, landscaping, sponge cities, pipeline networks (including underground comprehensive pipeline corridors), waste disposal (excluding waste-based power generation), municipal roads, buses, rail transit and others.

2. Transportation: including 12 grade-2 industries, i.e., expressways, first-class highways, second-class highways, railways, channel navigation, transportation hubs, ports and piers, airports, tunnels, bridges, warehouse logistics, and others.

3. Area development: including 5 grade-2 industries, i.e., park development, urbanization, land reserves, workshop construction and others.

msgPlace: Quarterly Report on the Project Library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform (No.3)
title: Quarterly Report on the Project Library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform (No.3)
txt:
Note:English version for reference only,Chinese version shall prevail.

Summary

According to the statistics from the National Public-Private Partnership (PPP) Integrated Information Platform established by the Ministry of Finance, as of June 30, 2016, the Ministry of Finance has approved two batches of demonstration projects (232 projects in total), with a total investment of RMB 802.54 billion. Among those demonstration projects, 105 are in the process of implementation, with a total investment of RMB 307.8 billion; the proportion of the PPP agreement signed reached 48.4%. Compared with the situation at the end of March, projects have been put into implementation more rapidly. Based on the project information entered, analysis was made on 53 demonstration projects, showing that the average cycle for a project to enter the implementation phase was 13.5 months; and the analysis of 82 demonstration projects indicated that the rate of participation of non-state-owned enterprises exceeded 40%; in terms of sector, the implementation of municipal engineering projects topped the projects in other sectors.

In terms of the situation in the whole country, local PPP projects demand continued to increase; at the end of June, there were 9,285 projects in the library, with a total investment of RMB 10.6 trillion; among them, 619 projects were in the process of implementation, with a total investment reaching RMB 1 trillion, which is spectacular; the proportion of the PPP agreement signed was 23.8%, and compared with the situation at the end of March, speed has been improved in starting to implement projects included in the library, leading to the rise in the proportion of the PPP agreement signed. According to the analyses,  the concentration ratios in terms of regions and sectors of the projects included in the library are relatively high; the projects in Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Xinjiang, Sichuan and Henan ranked top five in terms of number, and altogether surpassed half of the projects included in the library; the projects in the sector of municipal engineering, transport and area development ranked top three in terms of sector, totaling more than half of the projects included in the library. In respect of the project return mechanism, the proportions of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding increased slightly compared with the situation at the end of March.  

Text

In 2015, the Ministry of Finance issued the Circular on Regulating the Operation of the Public-Private Partnerships Integrated Information Platform (Cai Jin [2015] No.166), establishing the Public-Private Partnerships (PPP) Integrated Information Platform and the project library. As of June 30, 2016, there have been 9,285 projects included in the PPP Integrated Information Platform upon review as required, with a total investment of RMB 10.6 trillion; among those projects, 619 are in the process of implementation, with a total investment amounting to RMB 1 trillion; 232 are the demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance, with a total investment of RMB 802.54 billion, including 105 in the process of implementation with a total investment of RMB 307.8 billion.

The specific data is shown as follows:

I. Information on Demonstration Projects of the Ministry of Finance

The number of the first batch of PPP demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance in 2014 was 26 (original 30, while 4 were cancelled later); and the number of the second batch of demonstration projects in 2015 was 206; and the total number of demonstration projects reached 232, and the total investment amounted to RMB 802.54 billion.

(I) Projects entered the implementation phase more quickly

The full lifecycle management of PPP projects includes five stages, i.e., identification, preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer. The progress of the first two batches of demonstration projects as at the end of January, the end of March, and the end of June, is shown in Figures 1-1-1 and 1-1-2.

With respect to the demonstration projects entering the implementation phase, there were 66 at the end of January, with investment of RMB 214.6 billion; 73 at the end of March, with investment of RMB 226.7 billion; and 105 at the end of June, with investment of RMB 307.8 billion. Compared with the situation at the end of January, seven more projects were concluded and put into implementation at the end of March, showing an increase of 10.6%; and compared with the situation in the first quarter, 32 more projects concluded and put into implementation in the second quarter, showing an increase of 43.8%. Such substantial increase in the growth rate indicated that the demonstration projects entered the implementation phase more quickly.


 

Figure 1-1-1 Comparison of numbers of demonstration projects in each phase at the end of January, March, and June

 

Note: The number of projects in the identification phase at the end of June decreased while the investment in the same period increase as compared to the situation at the end of March; this is because the information on project phases furnished for a small number of projects with large investment amounts was incorrect in the first quarter, and such projects were corrected to be in the identification phase in the second quarter.

Figure 1-1-2 Comparison of investments of demonstration projects in each phase at the end of January, March, and June

(II) Proportion of the PPP agreement signed improved significantly

The proportion of the PPP agreement signed refers to the ratio between the sum of the numbers of the projects in the implementation and transfer phases and the sum of the numbers of the projects in the preparation, procurement, implementation and transfer phases. Because there is no project entering the transfer phase, the adjustment to the statistical criteria did not affect the consistency with the data published previously. The projects in the identification phase were not included in the calculation of the proportion of the PPP agreement signed, mainly out of the consideration that such projects have not undergone the value-for-money evaluation and the demonstration for financial capacity and could only be PPP project alternatives. By this criterion, the proportion of the PPP agreement signed of the two batches of demonstration projects at the end of June is 48.4%, up by 13.3 percentage points from 35.1% at the end of March, as shown in Figure 1-2-1.

 

Figure 1-2-1 Changes in the proportion of the PPP agreement signed of the two batches of demonstration projects

At the end of June, in the first batch of demonstration projects, 19 entered the implementation phase, with the proportion of the PPP agreement signed reaching 76%, and the projects that failed to start implementation were mainly those large rail transit projects which requires longer time for preparation and procurement; and in the second batch of demonstration projects, 86 entered the implementation phase, with the proportion of the PPP agreement signed reaching 45%. For the specific information, see Figure 1-2-2.

 

Figure 1-2-2  Proportion of the PPP agreement signed of the first and second batches of demonstration projects at the end of June

(III) Average cycle for concluding a PPP project contract is 13.5 months

The cycle for concluding a PPP project refers to the time actually taken from the initiation of the project to the signing of the PPP project contract. Currently, among the 105 signed demonstration projects, 53 have had their information on the cycle for concluding a PPP project entered into the platform; and the cycles ranging from 6 to 43 months, with the average being 13.5 months. For details, see Figure 1-3.

 

Figure 1-3 Distribution of cycles for concluding PPP project contracts of 53 demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance

Among the 53 demonstration projects, the average cycle for concluding a PPP project for the 26 municipal engineering projects was 12.8 months, for the 5 ecological construction projects 10.6 months, for the 5 water conservancy projects 13.2 months, and for the 3 transport projects 24 months.

(IV) Rate of participation of non-state-owned enterprises surpassed 40%

Currently, Among the 105 signed demonstration projects, 82 have had their information on the contracted social capitals entered into the platform, including 54 with single social capital and 28 with social capitals from consortiums (several enterprises to participate in one PPP project); the number of contracted social capitals was 119, among which 43 were private enterprises, 8 mixed ownership ones, 3 foreign-owned companies, and 65 state-owned enterprises (state-owned and state-controlled enterprises, including state-owned enterprises listed overseas). The proportion of private enterprises reached 36%, and the proportion for the first three categories of non-state-owned enterprises was 45%, as shown in Figure 1- 4-1.

Specifically, for the first batch of 13 demonstration projects, there were 16 private partners, including 8 state-owned enterprises, 7 private enterprises and 1 foreign-owned company; for the second batch of 69 demonstration projects, there were 103 private partners, including 57 state-owned enterprises, 36 private enterprises, 8 mixed-ownership enterprises and 2 foreign-owned companies.

 

Figure 1-4-1 Categories and proportions of 119 private partners

In the said 82 projects, the numbers of projects involving private enterprises, consortiums of private enterprises and foreign-owned companies, mixed ownership enterprises, state-owned enterprises, and consortiums not including private enterprises and foreign-owned companies were 17, 15, 4, 33 and13 respectively; the proportion of projects involving private enterprises and the consortiums of private enterprises and foreign-owned companies reached 39%, and the proportion of the first three categories of non-state-owned enterprises was 44%, as shown in Figure 1-4-2.

 

Figure 1-4-2 Distribution of 82 demonstration projects by the type of private capital

Of the 54 projects involving single private partner, the numbers of projects involving private enterprises, mixed ownership enterprises and state-owned enterprises were 17, 4, and 33 respectively, with the proportion of private enterprises participating in projects reaching 32%, and the proportion of the first two non-state-owned enterprises reaching 39%, as shown in Figure 1-4-3; the corresponding project investments were RMB 22.45 billion, RMB 98.91 billion, and RMB 72.62 billion, with the part of private enterprises accounting for 12% and the part of the first two categories of non-state-owned enterprises involved in the project accounting for 65%, as shown in Figure 1- 4-4.

Specifically, of the 17 projects involving single private enterprises, 8 were municipal engineering projects, with a total investment of RMB 4.46 billion; 2 medical care and health project, RMB 1.55 billion; one elderly care projects, RMB 13.08 billion; and one water conservancy project, RMB 1.33 billion; and one project on science and technology, energy, education, ecological construction and environmental protection, as well as tourism respectively, with a total investment of RMB 2.43 billion.

 

Figure 1-4-3 Distribution of 54 demonstration projects by the type of private capital

Figure 1-4-4 Distribution of the total investments of 54 demonstration projects by the type of private capital

(V) Municipal engineering projects took lead in terms of number

Among the 105 demonstration projects signed and to be implemented, the number of municipal engineering projects was 54, accounting for 51%; the number of ecological construction and environmental protection projects was 9, accounting for 9%; the number of transport projects was 8, accounting for 8%; the number of water conservancy construction projects is 8, accounting for 8%; and the number of other projects was 26, accounting for 24%. See Figure 1-5-1 for details. The total number of demonstration projects and the number of projects signed and to be implemented at the end of June in all sector are as shown in Figure 1-5-2.

 

Figure 1-5-1 Sectoral distribution of demonstration projects signed and to be implemented at the end of June

 

Figure 1-5-2  Comparison of the total number of demonstration projects and the number of projects signed and to be implemented at the end of June in all sectors

II. The projects included in the library

At the end of June, there were 9,285 projects in the library, with a total investment of RMB 10.6 trillion, representing respective increase of 1,564 projects and RMB1.8 trillion in the projects in the library and in the investment amount from the end of March; among them, 619 projects were in the process of implementation, with a total investment reaching RMB 1 trillion, representing an increase of 250 projects and RMB0.5 trillion in the projects in the process of implementation and in the investment amount from the end of March.

(I) Projects continue to increase, and projects to be implemented supported by considerable investment

The total number and number in stages of the projects included in the library from January to the end of June are as set out in Figure 2-1-1, and the investment amount are as set out in Figure 2-1-2. The projects included in the library increase by 457 and RMB0.5 trillion on average month by month, reflecting the increasing demand for PPP projects. It is necessary to point out that seventy percent of these projects are the PPP project alternatives in the identification stage. Because their planned implementation time is in the coming years; the value for money (VFM) assessment and financial affordability assessment have not been finished yet. The projects included in the library indicate that the local government departments just have the intention to adopt the PPP model, while it requires strict check before these projects become real PPP projects. . However, 619 projects were signed and to be implemented and the investment amount amounted to RMB1 trillion at the end of June s of the end of June, reflecting the considerable investment in the project.

 

Figure 2-1-1 Monthly change in the number of projects in stages

 

Figure 2-1-2 Monthly change in the investment amount in projects in stages (RMB' trillion)

(2) The projects included in the library implemented more quickly and the proportion of the PPP agreement signed rises stably

The projects in the execution stage amounted to 298, 369 and 619 at the end of January, March and June, respectively. Compared with the situation at the end of January, 71 more projects were concluded and put into implementation at the end of March, showing an increase of 23.8%; and compared with the situation in the first quarter, 250 more projects concluded and put into implementation in the second quarter, showing an increase of 67.7%. Such substantial increase in the growth rate indicated that the projects included in the library are implemented more quickly.

The proportion of the PPP agreement signed was 20%, 21.7% and 23.8% at the end of January, March and June, respectively, showing a stable growth. The number of projects in the preparation, procurement or implementation stage is as set out in Figure 2-2.

 

Figure 2-2  Distribution of projects in the preparation, procurement or implementation stage at the end of January, March and June

(III) Projects included in the library concentrate in some areas

The projects included in the library concentrate in Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Xinjiang, Sichuan and Henan, in which such projects amounted to 1,665, 1,034, 784, 748 and 699, respectively, contributing 53.1% to the total number of projects included in the library. In terms of investment in the projects included in the library, Shandong (including Qingdao), Guizhou, Yunnan, Henan, Sichuan and Jiangsu ranked the top six, with the investment of RMB1.3 trillion, RMB1.1 trillion, RMB823.8 billion, RMB787.8 billion, RMB783.8 billion and RMB532.1 billion, and accounting for 50.9% of the total investment of the projects included in the library.

Except that some projects in Shandong withdrew from the library, more projects were included in the library in other areas as at the end of June as compared with those as at the end of March. The projects in Inner Mongolia, Hebei, Guizhou and Xinjiang increased by 311, 237, 232 and 231, respectively, accounting for 64.6% of new projects in China. Guizhou, Hebei, Inner Mongolia, Hunan and Henan recorded large investments in new projects of RMB501.5 billion, RMB354.2 billion, RMB231.3 billion, RMB171.8 billion and RMB87.1 billion, respectively.

See Figure 2-3-1 and Figure 2-3-2 for comparisons of the projects and investment amount of different areas at the end of June and March.  

Figure 2-3-1 Regional distribution of the number of PPP projects

Figure 2-3-2 Regional distribution of the investment amounts in PPP projects

(IV) Projects included in the library concentrate in some sectors

The project library includes 19 primary sectors, such as energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, area development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical treatment and public health, pension, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructures and others. See the appendix for the introduction to sectors classification. See Figure 2-4-1 and Figure 2-4-2 for the numbers of and investment amounts in PPP projects in different sectors. In particular, municipal engineering, transportation and area development ranked the top three in terms of both the number of projects and investment amount, accounting for 53.1% and 67.2% of the total number and investment of projects included in the library, respectively.

As compared with the end of March, large numbers of new projects in municipal engineering, transportation and tourism amounted to 573, 243 and 92, respectively, as shown in Figure 2-4-3; and the new large investment amount in transportation, municipal engineering and low-cost housing projects amounted to RMB839.5 billion, RMB398.4 billion and RMB153.8 billion, respectively, as shown in Figure 2-4-4.

 

Figure 2-4-1 Sectoral distribution of numbers of PPP projects at the end of June

 


 

Figure 2-4-2 Sectoral distribution of investment amounts in PPP projects at the end of June (RMB'00,000,000)


 

Figure 2-4-3 Industrial distribution of numbers of new projects at the end of June as compared with the end of March


 

Figure 2-4-4 Sectoral distribution of additional investment amounts at the end of June as compared with the end of March

The following is the introduction to numbers and investment amounts of projects of municipal engineering, transportation and area development and comparisons with the end of March.

1. Municipal engineering: 3,241 projects recorded total investment demands of RMB2.8 trillion. In particular, there were 740, 514, 367 and 277 projects in Grade-4 sectors of sewage treatment, municipal roads, water supply and garbage treatment, accounting for 58.6% of the total number of municipal engineering projects; investment amount in projects in three sub-sectors of rail transit, municipal roads, pipeline networks and water supply amounted to RMB1 trillion, RMB399.4 billion and RMB322.1 billion, respectively, accounting for 64.6% of total investment amount municipal engineering projects.

As compared with the end of March, there were 537 new projects. Specifically, the new municipal roads, sewage treatment projects, garbage treatment projects, other projects and water supply in the sub-sectors amounted to 110, 93, 51, 50 and 48, accounting for 65.5% of new projects. There were new investment amounts of RMB398.5 billion. Specifically, there were great increases in investment amounts in others, municipal roads, pipeline networks, rail transits, sewage treatment in sub-sectors, which respectively rose by RMB83.9 billion, RMB78.3billion, RMB65.2 billion, RMB60.7 billion and RMB28.1 billion, accounting for 79.4% of total new investment amount, as shown in Figures 2-4-5 and 2-4-6.

 

Figure 2-4-5 Comparison of number of PPP projects of municipal engineering at the end of June with the end of March

Figure 2-4-6 Comparison of investment amounts in PPP projects of municipal engineering type at the end of June with the end of March

2. Transportation: 1,132 projects recorded total investment demands of RMB3.3 trillion. Specifically, the projects in first-class highways, expressways, other sectors and 4 second-class highways amounted to 268, 220, 125 and 125, respectively, accounting for 65.2% of the total number of transportation projects; the investments in 3 sub-sectors of expressways, first-class highways and railways (excluding rail transit) respectively amounted to RMB1.8 trillion, RMB507.2billion and RMB326.9 billion, respectively, accounting for 78.6% of the total investment of transportation projects.

As compared with January, there were 243 new projects. Specifically, there were as many as 64, 63, 37 new projects in expressways, first-class highways and second-class highways, respectively, accounting for 67.5% of new projects. The new investment amounted to RMB839.5 billion. Specifically, the investment amounts in expressways, first-class highways and railways amounted to RMB621.3 billion and RMB106.3 billion, respectively, accounting for 86.7% of total new investment amount, as shown in Figures 2-4-7 and 2-4-8.

 

Figure 2-4-7 Comparison of number of PPP projects of transportation type at the end of June with the end of March

 

Figure 2-4-8 Comparison of investment amounts in PPP projects of transportation type at the end of June with the end of March

3. Area development: 554 projects recorded total investment demands of RMB1 trillion. Specifically, the numbers of projects of 2 sub-sectors of park development and urbanization were 280 and 125, respectively, accounting for 73.1% of the total number of area development projects; the investment amounts in these 2 sub-sectors amounted to RMB476.5 billion and RMB360.6 billion, respectively, accounting for 82.7% of the total investment of area development projects.

As compared with March, there were 77 net new projects, including 42, 21, 12, 3 and 1 new project(s) in park development, urbanization, workshop construction, others and area development; and the new investment amounted to RMB153.8 billion, as shown in Figures 2-4-9 and 2-4-10.

 

Figure 2-4-9 Comparison of number of PPP projects of area development type at the end of June with the end of March

  

Figure 2-4-10 Comparison of investment amounts of PPP projects of area development type at the end of June with the end of March

(5) The proportions of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding increased slightly

According to statistics by the mechanism of three returns, there were 4,315 projects with user charges and the investment therein totaled RMB4.2 trillion, accounting for 46% of the total number of projects included in the library and 40% of total investment, respectively; there were 2,743 projects with government payments and the investment therein totaled RMB2.4 trillion, accounting for 30% and 22% respectively; and, there were 2,227 projects with viability gap funding and the investment therein totaled RMB4 trillion, accounting for 24% and 38%, respectively, as shown in Figures 2-5-1 and 2-5-2.

As compared with March, numbers of new projects with user charges, government payments and viability gap funding were 644, 532 and 388, respectively, and the new investment amounted to RMB551.2 billion, RMB421.3 billion and RMB846.2 billion, respectively. The proportions of projects with government payments and those with viability gap funding increased by 1 percentage point, respectively, compared with the situation at the end of March, as shown in Figures 2-5-3 and 2-5-4.

 

Figure 2-5-1 Distribution of numbers of projects included in the library by return mechanism at the end of June

Figure 2-5-2 Distribution of investment amounts of projects included in the library by return mechanism at the end of June (RMB'00,000,000)

 

Figure 2-5-3 Comparison of numbers of projects calculated by return of mechanism at the end of June with the end of March

 

Figure 2-5-4 Comparison of investment amounts calculated by return mechanism at the end of June with the end of March

 

Appendix:

Introduction toSectors Classification of Project Library

On the basis of the 13 sectors specified in the Circular of the General Office of the State Council on Forwarding the Guiding Opinions of the Ministry of Finance, National Development and Reform Commission and People's Bank of China on Promoting the Public-Private Partnership Mode in the Public Services (Guo Ban Fa [2015] No.42), the sectors  classification of the project library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform, which includes sectors and sub-sectors, is determined by taking the sectors classification standards adopted by the Department of Budget and the Department of Economic Construction and so on into full consideration. The 19 sectors s include energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, area development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical treatment and public health, the elderly care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructures and others. In particular, according to opinions of different parties, since March 2016, the sub-sector of "sewage treatment" has been transferred from the sectors of "ecological construction and environmental protection" to the "municipal engineering".

Sectors with large numbers of projects in the PPP project library and investment amounts are as below:

1. Municipal engineering: includes 18 sub-sectors such as water supply, water drainage, sewage treatment, power supply, gas supply, heat supply, cooling, parks, parking lots, squares, landscaping, sponge cities, pipeline networks (including underground comprehensive pipeline corridors), garbage treatment (excluding garbage power generation), municipal roads, buses, rail transit and others.

2. Transportation: includes 12 sub-sectors of expressways, first-class highways, second-class highways, railways, channel navigation, transportation hubs, ports and piers, airports, tunnels, bridges, warehouse logistics, and others.

3. Area development: includes 5 sub-sectors of park development, urbanization, land reserves, workshop construction and others.

title: Quarterly Report of the Project Library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform (No.2)
txt:
Note: English version for reference only, Chinese version shall prevail.

Summary: By the end of March 2016, 7,721 projects have been included into the project library (“the library”) of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform, increasing by 724 as compared with the end of January 2016, and investments have totalled RMB8,780.247 billion, rising by RMB648.047 billion. In particular, there were 646 projects in implementation library (i.e. projects at phases of procurement, implementation and transfer), accounting for 8.4% of total number of projects in the project library and increasing by 96 as compared with the end of January; there were 7,075 ones in reserve library, accounting for 91.6% and increasing by 628. As calculated by the ratio of number of projects at the implementation phase to the total number of projects at the phases of preparations, procurement and implementation, the proportion of the PPP agreement signed of projects included in the library was 21.7%, rising by 2% as compared with the end of January.

There were 116 demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance included into the implementation library, accounting for 49.8% of all the demonstration projects and increasing by 13 as compared with the end of January; particularly, there were 73 demonstration projects that had been implemented, accounting for 31.3% and increasing by 10; and, the proportion of the PPP agreement signed was 35.1%, up by 2.5% as compared with the end of January.

According to statistics by region, projects in Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Sichuan, Henan and Xinjiang ranked the top five in terms of number, totalling 4,383 ones, and accounting for 56.8% of the total number of projects included in the library; projects in Shandong (including Qingdao), Guizhou, Yunnan, Henan, Sichuan and Jiangsu ranked the top six in terms of investment, totalling RMB4.56 trillion, and accounting for 51.9% of the total investment of the projects included in the library. According to statistics by sectors, projects in municipal engineering, transportation and area development ranked the top three in terms of both number and investment. Projects totalled 4,070, accounting for 52.7% of the total number of projects included in the library; investment totalled RMB5.73 trillion, accounting for 65.2% of the total investment of projects included in the library. According to statistics by return mechanism, there were 3,671 projects with user charges and the investment thereof totalled RMB3.63 trillion, accounting for 47.5% of the total number of projects included in the library and 41.3% of total investment respectively; there were 2,211 projects with government payments and the investment thereof totalled RMB1.94 trillion, accounting for 28.6% and 22.2% respectively; and, there were 1,839 projects with viability gap funding and the investment thereof totalled RMB3.21 trillion, accounting for 23.8% and 36.5% respectively. 

Text:

By March 31, 2016, as per requirements in the Circular on Regulating the Operation of the Public-Private Partnerships Integrated Information Platform (Cai Jin [2015] No.166), there were 7,721 projects included in the project library (“the library”) of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform upon review, with total investment of RMB8,780.247 billion. Specifically, there were 232 demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance, with total investment of RMB803.499 billion. The information statistics of the project library are reported as below:

I. Demonstration Projects of the Ministry of Finance

Except that the garbage treatment project of Nanjing, Jiangsu actively withdrew from demonstration, two batches of demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance, totalling 232, have been included in the library. In particular, 24 projects were at the phase of identification, down by 5 as compared with the end of January (the same below); 93 ones were at the phase of preparations, down by 5; 42 ones were at the phase of procurement, up by 5; 73 ones were at the implementation phase, up by 9; and, there was not any project at the phase of transfer. Demonstration projects at the phases of procurement and implementation accounted for 18% and 32% respectively. As calculated by the ratio of number of projects at the implementation phase to the total number of projects at the phases of preparations, procurement and implementation, the proportion of the PPP agreement signed of demonstration projects was 35.1% at the end of March, rising by 2.5% as compared with 32.6% of the proportion of the PPP agreement signed of demonstration projects at the end of January. See Figure 1-1 and Figure 1-2 of the progress of demonstration projects.


 

Figure 1-1 Number of demonstration projects of the central finance calculated by implementation phase at the end of March 

 

Figure 1-2 Investment of demonstration projects of the central finance calculated by implementation phase at the end of March

II. All Projects in the Project Library

By the end of March 2016, 7,721 projects have been included into the project library, increasing by 724 as compared with the end of January 2016, and investments have totalled RMB8,780.247 billion, rising by RMB648.047 billion. In particular, there were1,051, 277 and 369 projects at the phases of preparations, procurement and implementation respectively; as calculated by the ratio of number of projects at the implementation phase to the total number of projects at the phases of preparations, procurement and implementation, the implementation rate of projects included in the library was 21.7%.

(I) Statistics by region

In terms of the number of projects included in the library, Guizhou, Shandong (including Qingdao), Sichuan, Henan and Xinjiang ranked the top five, with the number of the projects of 1,433, 1,042, 736, 619 and 553 respectively, and accounting for 56.8% of the total number of projects included in the library. Additionally, the review of project information has been consolidated in all the regions since February, and some projects of some provinces have been withdrawn from the library. Specifically, projects withdrawn from the library were more than new projects in some provinces, so the projects included in the library at the end of March were less than those at the end of January.

In terms of investment of projects included in the library, Shandong (including Qingdao), Guizhou, Yunnan, Henan, Sichuan and Jiangsu ranked the top six, with the investment of RMB1,136.8 billion, RMB834.7 billion, RMB769.8 billion, RMB736.7 billion, RMB702.4 billion and RMB478.4 billion, and accounting for 51.9% of the total investment of the projects included in the library.

As compared with January, Inner Mongolia, Xinjiang, Shaanxi and Fujian (including Xiamen) recorded many new projects: respectively 144, 100, 79 and 73, accounting for 54.7% of the total number of new projects. Heilongjiang, Fujian (including Xiamen), Hunan, Chongqing and Xinjiang recorded a large investment amount of new projects: respectively RMB138.4 billion, RMB132.4 billion, RMB67.5 billion, RMB61.4 billion and RMB56.8 billion.

See Figure 2-1-1 and Figure 2-2-2 for comparisons of the numbers of projects and investment amounts of different regions at the end of March and January.

 

Figure 2-1-1 Regional distribution of the numbers of PPP projects

 

Figure 2-1-2 Regional distribution of the investment amounts of PPP projects

(2) Statistics by industry

The project library includes 19 Grade-1 industries: energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, area development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical treatment and public health, elderly care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructures and others. See the appendix for the introduction to industry classification. In particular, according to opinions of different parties, since March 2016, the Grade-2 industry of "sewage treatment" has been transferred from the Grade-1 industry of "ecological construction and environmental protection" to the Grade-1 industry of "municipal engineering". See Figure 2-2-2 and Figure 2-2-3 for the numbers and investments of PPP projects in different industries. In particular, three Grade-1 industries: municipal engineering, transportation and area development ranked the top three in terms of both the number of projects and investment, accounting for 52.7% and 65.2% of the total number and investment of projects included in the library respectively.

As compared with the end of January, there were many new projects in 4 industries of municipal engineering, transportation, tourism and education: respectively 876 (including 647 sewage treatment projects transferred into the industry of municipal engineering), 128, 85 and 41; there were large new investments in 3 industries of municipal engineering, transportation and water conservancy construction: respectively RMB323.5 billion (including RMB155.7 billion of the investment amount of sewage treatment projects), RMB250.2 billion and RMB39.3 billion.

 

Figure 2-2-1 Industrial distribution of numbers of PPP projects at the end of March

 

Figure 2-2-2 Industrial distribution of investments of PPP projects at the end of March

 

Figure 2-2-3 Industrial distribution of numbers of new projects at the end of March as compared with the end of January

 

Figure 2-2-4 Industrial distribution of new investment amounts at the end of March as compared with the end of January

The following is the introduction to numbers and investment amounts of projects of municipal engineering, transportation and area development and comparisons with the end of January.

1. Municipal engineering: There were 2,704 projects, with total investment of RMB2,384.6 billion. Specifically, the numbers of projects in 4 Grade-2 industries of sewage treatment, municipal roads, water supply and garbage treatment were respectively 647, 404, 319 and 226, accounting for 59% of the total number of municipal engineering projects. The large investments in 3 Grade-2 industries of rail transit, municipal roads and pipeline network respectively amounted to RMB980 billion, RMB321.1 billion and RMB256.9 billion, accounting for 69.9% of the total investment of municipal engineering projects.

As compared with the end of January, there were 876 new projects (including 647 sewage treatment projects transferred into the industry of municipal engineering). Specifically, there were many new projects of sewage treatment, heating and municipal roads: respectively 647, 35 and 31, accounting for 81.4% of new projects. There were new investment amounts of RMB323.5 billion. Specifically, there were great increases in investment amounts of sewage treatment (as calculated by 647 projects transferred into the industry of municipal engineering), rail transit, pipeline networks, municipal roads and water supply, which respectively rose by RMB155.7 billion, RMB79.7 billion, RMB27.1 billion, RMB12.6 billion and RMB10.7 billion, accounting for 88.3% of total new investment amount.

 

Figure 2-2-5 Comparison of numbers of PPP projects of municipal engineering type at the end of March with the end of January

 

Figure 2-2-6 Comparison of investment amounts of PPP projects of municipal engineering type at the end of March with the end of January

2. Transportation: There were 889 projects with total investment of RMB2,484.3 billion. Specifically, the numbers of projects in 3 Grade-2 industries of first-class highways, expressways and second-class highways were respectively 205, 156 and 113, accounting for 53.3% of the total number of transportation projects; the investments in 3 Grade-2 industries of expressways, first-class highways and railways (excluding rail transit) respectively amounted to RMB1,157.6 billion, RMB400.9 billion and RMB319.2 billion, accounting for 75.6% of the total investment of transportation projects.

As compared with January, there were 128 new projects. Specifically, there were many new projects of expressways, first-class highways and second-class highways: respectively 28, 17 and 14, accounting for 46% of new projects. There were new investment amounts of RMB250.2 billion. Specifically, there were great increases in investment amounts of expressways, first-class highways and railways, which respectively rose by RMB130 billion, RMB59.8 billion and RMB47 billion, accounting for 94.6% of total new investment amount.

 

Figure 2-2-7 Comparison of number of PPP projects of transportation type at the end of March with the end of January

 

Figure 2-2-8 Comparison of investment amounts of PPP projects of transportation type at the end of March with the end of January

3. Area development: There were 477 projects with total investment of RMB858.9 billion. Specifically, the numbers of projects of 3 Grade-2 industries of park development, urbanization and others were respectively 238, 104 and 60, accounting for 84.3% of the total number of area development projects; the investment amounts in these 3 Grade-2 industries were respectively RMB413.9 billion, RMB291.5 billion and RMB77.1 billion, accounting for 91.1% of the total investment of area development projects.

As compared with January, there were 10 net new products. Specifically, there were 10 new projects of park development, 6 of urbanization and 1 of workshop construction, and projects of land reserves and others decreased by 2 and 5 respectively; investment amount decreased by RMB40.6 billion, mainly because industry departments of relevant regions have adjusted data of investment amounts of some area development projects, and significantly, the number of urbanization projects rose but investment amount dropped by RMB46.9 billion.

 

Figure 2-2-9 Comparison of number of PPP projects of area development type at the end of March with the end of January

 

Figure 2-2-10 Comparison of investment amounts of PPP projects of area development type at the end of March with the end of January

(3) Statistics by return mechanism

According to statistics by the mechanism of three returns, there were 3,671 projects with user charges and the investment thereof totalled RMB3.63 trillion, accounting for 47.5% of the total number of projects included in the library and 41.3% of total investment respectively; there were 2,211 projects with government payments and the investment thereof totalled RMB1.94 trillion, accounting for 28.6% and 22.2% respectively; and, there were 1,839 projects with viability gap funding and the investment thereof totalled RMB3.21 trillion, accounting for 23.8% and 36.5% respectively.

As compared with January, numbers of new projects with user charges, government payments and viability gap funding were respectively 333, 211 and 180, with new investment amounts of RMB192 billion, RMB295.9 billion and RMB160.2 billion respectively.

 

Figure 2-3-1 Distribution of numbers of projects included in the library by return mechanism at the end of March

 

Figure 2-3-2 Distribution of investment amounts of projects included in the library by return mechanism at the end of March

 

Figure 2-3-3 Comparison of numbers of projects calculated by return of mechanism at the end of March with the end of January

 

Figure 2-3-4 Comparison of investment amounts calculated by return mechanism at the end of March with the end of January

(4) Statistics by execution phase

There were 6,024 projects at the phase of identification, and investment demands amounted to RMB6.06 trillion, accounting for 78.0% of the total number of projects included in the library and 69.1% of total investment respectively; there were 1,051 projects at the phase of preparations, and investment demands amounted to RMB1.75 trillion, accounting for 13.6% and 19.9% respectively; there were 277 projects at the phase of procurement, and investment demands amounted to RMB451.1 billion, accounting for 3.6% and 5.1% respectively; there were 369 projects at the implementation phase, and investment demands amounted to RMB513.8 billion, accounting for 4.8% and 5.9%; and, there was no project at the phase of transfer.

As calculated by the ratio of number of projects at the implementation phase to the number of projects at the phases of preparations, procurement and implementation, the implementation rate of projects included in the project library was 21.7%, rising by 2% as compared with the implementation rate of 19.6% at the end of January.

 

Figure 2-4-1 Number of projects included in the library calculated by execution phase at the end of March

 

Figure 2-4-2 Investment of projects included in the library calculated by execution phase at the end of March

As compared with January, numbers of projects at the phases of identification, preparations, procurement and implementation rose by 520, 108, 25 and 76 respectively. Among 76 new projects at the implementation phase, 5 have been included in the library in January, but a wrong record is made for the projects at the transfer phase. See Figure 2-4-3 for comparison of the number of projects calculated by the PPP execution phase and Figure 2-4-4 for comparison of investment amounts with January.

 

Figure 2-4-3 Comparison of numbers of projects calculated by execution phase at the end of March with the end of January

 

Figure 2-4-4 Comparison of investment amounts calculated by execution phase at the end of March with the end of January


Appendix:

Introduction to Industry Classification of Project Library

On the basis of the 13 industries specified in the Circular of the General Office of the State Council on Forwarding the Guiding Opinions of the Ministry of Finance, National Development and Reform Commission and People's Bank of China on Promoting the Public-Private Partnership Mode in the Public Services (Guo Ban Fa [2015] No.42), the industry classification of the project library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform, which includes Grade-1 industries and Grade-2 industries, is determined by taking the industry classification standards adopted by the Department of Budget and the Department of Economic Construction and so on into full consideration. The 19 Grade-1 industries are: energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, area development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical treatment and public health, elderly care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructures and others. In particular, according to opinions of different parties, since March 2016, the Grade-2 industry of "sewage treatment" has been transferred from the Grade-1 industry of "ecological construction and environmental protection" to the Grade-1 industry of "municipal engineering".

Grade-1 industries with large numbers of projects in the PPP project library and investment amounts are as below:

1. Municipal engineering: includes 18 Grade-2 industries of water supply, water drainage, sewage treatment, power supply, gas supply, heating, cooling, parks, parking lots, squares, landscaping, sponge cities, pipeline networks (including underground pipe racks), garbage treatment (excluding garbage power generation), municipal roads, buses, rail transit and others.

2. Transportation: includes 12 Grade-2 industries of expressways, first-class highways, second-class highways, railways, channel navigation, transportation hubs, ports and piers, airports, tunnels, bridges and warehouse logistics.

3. Area development: includes 5 Grade-2 industries of park development, urbanization, land reserves, workshop construction and others.

msgPlace: Quarterly Report on the Project Library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform (No.1)
title: Quarterly Report on the Project Library of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform (No.1)
txt:
Note:English version for reference only,Chinese version shall prevail.

Overview

By January 31, 2016, in accordance with the Circular on Regulating the Operation of the Public-Private Partnership Integrated Information Platform (Cai Jin [2015] No.166), 6,997 projects among 9,283 projects reported nationwide and reviewed by all the finance departments at the provincial level, have been included into the project library ("the library") of the National PPP Integrated Information Platform of the Ministry of Finance, with total investment demands amounting to RMB8,132.2 billion.

According to statistics by region, projects in Guizhou, Shandong, Sichuan, Henan and Xinjiang ranked the top five in terms of number, totalling 4,243 ones, and accounting for 60.6% of the total number of projects included in the library; investment demands in Guizhou, Yunnan, Henan, Jiangsu and Liaoning ranked the top five, totalling RMB3.16 trillion, and accounting for 51.3% of the total investment demands of the projects included in the library. According to statistics by industry, projects in municipal engineering, ecological construction and environmental protection, transportation and area development ranked the top four in terms of number, totalling 4,034 ones, and exceeding 50% of the total number of projects included in the library; investment demands thereof totalled RMB5.79 trillion, accounting for 71.2% of the total investment demands of projects included in the library. According to statistics by return mechanism, there were 3,338 projects with user charges and the investment demands thereof amounted to RMB3.4 trillion, accounting for 47.7% of the total number of projects included in the library and 42.3% of total investment demands respectively; there were 2,000 projects with government payments and the investment demands thereof amounted to RMB1.8 trillion, accounting for 28.6% and 21.9% respectively; and, there were 1,659 projects with viability gap funding and the investment demands thereof amounted to RMB2.9 trillion, accounting for 23.7% and 35.8% respectively.

Two batches of demonstration projects released by the Ministry of Finance have been included in the library. The whole life cycle of PPP projects determined pursuant to the Operational Guidance for Public-private Partnership Mode (for Trial Implementation) is divided into five phases: identification, preparations, procurement, implementation and transfer. There are 66 demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance that have been entered into the implementation phase, accounting for about 30% of the total number of demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance; and, there are 38 demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance at the procurement phase, accounting for about 16% of the total number of demonstration projects of the Ministry of Finance.

Region conditions

By January 31, 2016, 6,997 PPP projects in 33 provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the Central Government and cities specifically designated in the state plan have been included in the project library. Projects in Guizhou, Shandong, Sichuan, Henan and Xinjiang ranked the top five in terms of number, respectively 1,492 ones, 974 ones, 734 ones, 590 ones and 453 ones, and accounting for 60.6% of the total number of projects included in the library in total; and, projects in Guizhou, Yunnan, Henan, Jiangsu and Liaoning ranked the top five in terms of investment demands, respectively amounting to RMB916.2 billion, RMB752.7 billion, RMB703.5 billion, RMB465.1 billion and 391.1 billion, and accounting for 51.3% of total investment demands of projects included in the library in total.

See Figure 1 and Figure 2 for the numbers of projects included in the library and investment demands in different regions.

Figure 1Regional distribution of numbers of PPP projects

Figure 2 Regional distribution of investment demands of PPP projects

Industry conditions

On the basis of the 13 industries specified in the Circular of the General Office of the State Council on Forwarding the Guiding Opinions of the Ministry of Finance, National Development and Reform Commission and People's Bank of China on Promoting the Public-Private Partnership Mode in the Public Services (Guo Ban Fa [2015] No.42), the industry classification of the PPP project library is determined in combination with budget management requirements of government expenditure responsibility of PPP projects and by taking the industry classification standards adopted by the Department of Budget and the Department of Economic Construction of the Ministry of Finance and so on into full consideration. The project library includes 19 industries: energy, transportation, water conservancy construction, ecological construction and environmental protection, municipal engineering, area development, agriculture, forestry, science and technology, low-cost housing projects, tourism, medical treatment and public health, elderly care, education, culture, sports, social security, government infrastructures and others. See Figure 3 and Figure 4 for the numbers and investments of PPP projects in different industries. In particularly, projects in four industries of municipal engineering, ecological construction and environmental protection, transportation and area development ranked the top four in terms of number, accounting for 57.7% of total projects included in the library. Specifically:

Figure 3 Industrial distribution of numbers of PPP projects


Figure 4 Industrial distribution of investment demands of PPP projects

1. Municipal engineering: 1,828 projects recorded total investment demands of RMB2.1 trillion. In particular, there were 373, 292, 212 and 188 projects in four Grade-2 industries of municipal roads, water supply, garbage treatment and pipelines, accounting for 58.3% of the total number of municipal engineering projects; investment demands of projects in four Grade-2 industries of rail transit, municipal roads, pipeline networks and water supply amounted to RMB900.3 billion, RMB308.5 billion, RMB229.8 billion and RMB99.8 billion respectively, accounting for 74.6% of total investment demands of municipal engineering projects in total.

Figure 5 Distribution of numbers of PPP projects in municipal engineering industry

Figure 6 Distribution of investment demands of PPP projects in municipal engineering industry 

2. Ecological construction and environmental protection: 978 projects recorded total investment demands of RMB526.4 billion. In particular, there were 614, 259 and 64 projects in three Grade-2 industries of sewage treatment, comprehensive treatment and wetland protection, accounting for 95.8% of the total number of ecological construction and environmental protection projects in total; investment demands of projects in three Grade-2 industries of comprehensive treatment, sewage treatment and wetland protection amounted to RMB298.3 billion, RMB144.6 billion and RMB59.5 billion respectively, accounting for 95.5% of the total investment demands of ecological construction and environmental protection projects in total.

Return mechanism conditions

According to statistics by return mechanisms of user charges, government payments and viability gap funding, there were 3,338 projects with user charges and the investment demands thereof amounted to RMB3.4 trillion, accounting for 47.7% of the total number of projects and 42.3% of total investment demands respectively; there were 2,000 projects with government payments and the investment demands thereof amounted to RMB1.8 trillion, accounting for 28.6% and 21.9% respectively; and, there were 1,659 projects with viability gap funding and the investment demands thereof amounted to RMB2.9 trillion, accounting for 23.7% and 35.8% respectively. See Figure 13 for numbers of projects calculated by return mechanism, and Figure 14 for investment demands.
